materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® Original (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Contrast A Hot Green (01712) 1 ball or 25 yds/23 m
Contrast B Country Red (01530) 1 ball or 10 yds/9 m
Contrast C Soft Ecru (01004) 1 ball or 25 yds/23 m
Contrast D Mod Green (01223) 1 ball or 22 yds/20 m
Contrast E Hot Blue (01742) 1 ball or 17 yds/16 m
Contrast F Hot Pink (07140) 1 ball or 19 yds/17 m
Size U.S. G/6 [4 mm] Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Approx 6" x 9" [15 x 23 cm] to fit 4-cup tea pot.
gauge: 15 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm]. Motif = 4½" [11.5 cm] square.
instructions:
GRANNY SQUARES (See diagram on page 2).
Notes:
• Beg ch-6 counts as (1 dc and ch-3 sp).
• Join all rnds with sl st to 3rd ch of beg ch-6.
Make 1 using A as Color 1, E as Color 2, D as Color 3 and C as Color 4.
Make 1 using C as Color 1, B as Color 2, F as Color 3, and A as Color 4.
Make 1 using F as Color 1, D as Color 2, C as Color 3, and E as Color 4.
Make 1 using F as Color 1, C as Color 2, A as Color 3 and D as Color 4.
With Color 1, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: (RS). Ch 6. (3 dc in ring. Ch 3) 3 times. 2 dc in ring. Join. Fasten off. 12 dc and 4 ch-3 sps.
2nd rnd: Join Color 2 with sl st in any ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join. Fasten off. 24 dc, 4 ch-1 sps and 4 ch-3 sps.
3rd rnd: Join Color 3 with sl st in any ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 3 dc in last ch-1sp. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join. Fasten off. 36 dc, 8 ch-1 sps and 4 ch-3 sps.
4th rnd: Join Color 4 with sl st in any ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-2 sp. *(Ch 1. 3 dc) in each ch-1 sp across to next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. (Ch 1. 3 dc) in each ch-1 sp across to first ch-3 sp. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join. Fasten off. 48 dc, 12 ch-1 sps and 4 ch-3 sps.
Seam Squares tog in two pairs as shown in Assembly Diagram.
ASSEMBLY DIAGRAM
Whipstitch pairs tog along top and bottom of sides, leaving 3½" [9 cm] open at center of each side seam for Handle and Spout.
WHIPSTITCH
Bottom Edging
1st rnd: Join B with sl st to any ch-3 sp along bottom of Squares. Ch 1. Work 1 sc in each st and ch-sp around bottom of Tea Cozy. Join D with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: With D, ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Top Edging
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnds does not count as st. Always beg rnds in first st.
Join F with sl st to any ch-3 sp along top of Squares.
1st rnd: Ch 2. 1 dc in each st and ch-sp around. Join. 68 dc. Break F. Join E.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. *1 dc in each of next 2 sts. Dc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. Break E. Join C. 51 dc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. *1 dc in next st. Dc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 34 dc. Break C. Join A.
4th rnd: Ch 2. *Dc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 17 dc.
5th rnd: Ch 2. 1 dc in first dc. *Dc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 9 dc. Fasten off.
Break yarn, leaving a long end. Thread end through 9 rem sts to close top of Cozy.
Pompom
Wind C, E, and F held tog around 3 fingers approx 25 times. Remove from fingers and tie tightly in center with length of yarn approx 12" [30.5 cm] long. Cut through each side of loops. Trim to a smooth round shape. Sew to top of Tea Cozy as shown in photo.

materials: 1 skein each 312 Black A and 254 Pumpkin B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 5.5mm [US I-9] and 6.5mm [US K-10½]
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Cozy fits 12-ounce bottle.
gauge: Rounds 1–4 = 2½" (6.5 cm) with smaller hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
COZY
With smaller hook and A, make an adjustable ring, ch 1.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc—12 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in first st, 2 sc in next st, *sc in next st, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—18 sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sts, 2 sc in next st, *sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—24 sc.
Round 5: Ch 1, sc in first st, *ch 7, skip next 3 sts, sc in next st; repeat from * 4 times, ch 3, dc in first sc (ch 3 and dc count as last ch-7 space here and throughout)—6 ch-7 spaces.
Round 6: Ch 1, sc around post of dc of last ch-7 space, *ch 7, sc in 4th ch of next ch-7 space; repeat from * 4 times, ch 3, dc in first sc—6 ch-7 spaces.
Rounds 7–10: Repeat Round 6.
Round 11: Ch 1, 3 sc around post of dc of last ch-7 space, 3 sc in 4th ch of each remaining ch-7 space; join with slip st in first sc—18 sc.
Round 12: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.

SKULL
Motif
With smaller hook and A, ch 6.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—5 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Rows 3 and 4: Repeat Row 2.
Row 5: Ch 1, 3 sc in first st, sc in next 3 sts, 3 sc in last st, turn—9 sc.
Rows 6–8: Repeat Row 2.
Row 9: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each st across to last 2 sts, sc2tog, turn—7 sc.
Rows 10 and 11: Repeat Row 9—3 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

Base
With larger hook and B, repeat Rows 1–11 of skull.

ASSEMBLY & FINISHING
Referring to photograph as a guide, with straight stitches and B, embroider eyes and mouth on skull motif. Center motif on its base and with long tail of motif, sew together.

Slip cozy on bottle. Place motif on cozy and with long tail of base, sew in place. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Soft®: 1 ball 4601 Off White A
RED HEART® Soft Baby Steps®: 1 ball each 9700 Baby Pink B and 9590 Lavender C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 6.0mm [US J-10], 3.5mm [US E-4], 2.75mm [US C-2]
Two ½” (13 mm) black buttons for Eyes
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Cozy fits doorknobs 6¼” (16 cm) around.
gauge: With 6.0mm [J-10] hook, 16 sc = 4” [10 cm]; 20 rows = 4” [10 cm]. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size needles/hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
Ear (Make 2)
Make one Ear with B and one with C. With 3.5mm [E-4] hook, ch 2.
Round 1: 4 sc in 2nd ch from hook—4 sc.
Round 2: [2 sc in next sc, sc] twice—6 sc.
Round 3: [2 sc in next sc] around—12 sc.
Round 4: [5 sc, 2 sc in next sc] twice—14 sc.
Round 5: Sc in each sc around—14 sc.
Round 6: [Draw up a loop in next sc] 3 times, yarn over and draw through all 4 loops on hook, slip st into next st; leave remaining 12 stitches unworked—2 sts. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing Ear to Head.
Nose
With 2.75mm [C-2] hook and C, ch 3.
Row 1: 2 dc in 3rd ch from hook, ch 2, slip st into same st as last dc—4 sts. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing and embroidery.
FINISHING
Referring to photograph for placement, sew Nose to center of Cozy. Embroider whiskers on both sides of Nose. Sew button Eyes above Nose. Sew Ears above Eyes. Weave in all ends.
COZY
Head
With 6.0mm [J-10] hook and A, ch 2.
Round 1: 6 sc in second ch from hook—6 sc.
Round 2: [Sc, 2 sc in next sc] around; slip st in first sc to join—9 sc. Fasten off; weave in ends.
Join B, ch 1.
Round 3: [2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] around—12 sc.
Round 4: [Sc, 2 sc in next sc, 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] twice, sc, 2 sc in next sc—17 sc.
Round 5: 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc, [3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 3 times, 2 sc—21 sc.
Round 6: [6 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 3 times—24 sc.
Round 7: 11 sc, 2 sc in next sc, 12 sc—25 sc.
Round 8: Sc in each sc around—25 sc.
Round 9: 12 sc, sc2tog, 11 sc; ch 1, turn—24 sc.
Round 10: [6 sc, sc2tog] 3 times; ch 1, turn—21 sc.
Round 11: [3 sc, sc2tog] 4 times, sc; ch 1, turn—17 sc.
Round 12: [sc, sc2tog] 5 times, 2 sc—12 sc. Fasten off, weave in ends.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® Super Craft Kit™ Brights
Set includes 12 balls (50 g/1.7 oz each; 600 g/21 oz total), yardage (93 yds/85 m each; 1116 yds/1020 m total)
Heart Version - Light Jasmine 27 yds/25 m
Strawberry Version - Hot Red 27 yds/25 m
Tiger Version - Day Glow Orange 29 yds/26 m
Each Photocard holder uses 27 yds/25 m of Main Color.
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Small amount of black Red Heart® Super Saver® for embroidery details on Frog, Bunny and Tiger Versions.
Ball Bead Chain or Key Rings.
measurements: To fit 2¼" x 3½" [5.5 x 9 cm] Photocard. Finished size: Approx 4" x 5" [10 x 12.5 cm].
gauge: 14 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
BASIC HOLDER  
FRONT  
See diagrams on page 4.  
**Ch 13.  
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 12 sc.  
2nd and 3rd rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.**  
Make Left Side: 1st row: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 3 sc.  
2nd to 11th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.  
Fasten off at end of 11th row.  
Make Right Side: With RS facing, join yarn with sl st to first sc.  
1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Turn. Leave rem sc unworked. 3 sc.  
2nd to 10th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.  
Join Sides: Next row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Ch 6. Join with sl st to first of Left Side. Fasten off.  
Top: 1st row: (RS). Join yarn with sl st to first sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 ch. 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Turn. 12 sc.  
2nd and 3rd rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.  
Fasten off at end of 3rd row.  
BACK  
Work from ** to ** as given for Front.  
4th to 16th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row.  
17th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Ch 3 (Keychain loop). 1 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Fasten off.  
Join Front and Back: With WS of Front and Back tog, align sides and bottom. With Front facing, join with sl st to top left corner.  
Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses to join, work 16 sc (1 sc in side of each row) evenly down left side edge. Work 2 sc in bottom corner. Work sc evenly along bottom through rem loop of foundation ch, working 2 sc in last ch. Work 16 sc up right side edge. Fasten off at top.  
Attach Ball Bead Chain or Key Ring to ch-3 Keychain loop on Back.  
HEART VERSION  
With Light Jasmine, work Basic Holder.  
Heart  
With Pretty N’ Pink, ch 3. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.  
1st rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). (2 dc. 3 hdc. 1 dc. 3 hdc. 2 dc) in ring. Ch 3. Sl st in ring. Fasten off.  
Pull beg tail tightly to close up ring and secure on WS.  
Sew Heart to front of Holder at top left corner.  
FROG VERSION  
With Minty, work Basic Holder.  
Eyes (make 2)  
With White, ch 3.  
1st row: (RS). 6 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Fasten off.  
2nd row: (RS). Join Minty with sl st to first hdc. Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 hdc. 2 sc in each of next 2 hdc. 1 sc in each of last 2 hdc. 8 sc. Fasten off.  
Sew Eyes to Holder along top of Front.  
With Black yarn, embroider pupils and smile.  
STRAWBERRY VERSION  
With Hot Red, work Basic Holder.  
Stem  
With Minty, ch 8. Sl st in first ch. Ch 12. Sl st in same ch as last sl st. Ch 8. Sl st in same ch as last sl st. Ch 12. Sl st in same ch as last sl st. Fasten off.  
Sew Stem to Front of Holder in center.  
With White, embroider ‘seeds’ using short straight stitches.  
BUNNY VERSION  
With White, work Basic Holder.  
Ears (make 2)  
With Pretty N’ Pink, ch 7.  
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 4 ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working into rem loops of foundation ch, 1 sc in each of next 5 ch. Fasten off.  
2nd row: (RS). Join White with sl st to first sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Fasten off.  
Sew Ears to Holder along top of Front.  
Nose  
With White, ch 3. 8 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first hdc. Fasten off.  
With Black yarn, embroider an ‘X’ on Nose.  
Sew Nose to Front of holder at top in center.  
With Black yarn, embroider eyes.  
TIGER VERSION  
With Day Glow Orange, work Basic Holder. Do not fasten off at top right corner when joining.  
Ears  
Skip first 2 sc. 8 dc in 3rd sc. Skip next 2 sc. Sl st in next 2 sc. Skip next 2 sc. 8 dc in next sc. Sl st in side of first sc of side join. Fasten off.  
Nose  
With Day Glow Orange, ch 3. 8 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first hdc. Fasten off.  
With Black yarn, embroider Nose as shown in picture.  
Sew Nose to Front of Holder at top in center.  
With Black yarn, embroider eyes along each side of Nose.  
Embroider Whiskers on either side of Holder on Front.  
BASIC HOLDER DIAGRAMS (ALL VERSIONS)

materials: Lily® Sugar'n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m) Contrast A Hot Pink (01740) 1 ball
Lily® Sugar'n Cream® Scents (2 oz/56.7 g; 95 yds/86 m) Contrast E Vanilla Bouquet (24003) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: To fit 4 cup (6 cup) tea pot.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions: COZY (Front and Back make alike). Stripe Pat: Work 2 rows of each color in the following sequence: A, B, C, D, E, F, G, F, E, D, C, B, A. (See Chart 1 on page 2). With A, ch 29 (36). 1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. [Ch 10 (loop). Miss next ch. 1 sc in each of next 6 ch] 3 (4) times. Ch 10 (loop). Miss next ch. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. Turn. 2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. [Ch 10 (loop). Miss next ch-10 sp. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc] 3 (4) times. Ch 10 (loop). Miss next ch-10 sp. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Turn. First 2 rows of Stripe Pat are complete. Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep last row until work from beg measures approx 4 (5)" [10 (12.5) cm], ending with a WS row. Shape Top: (See Chart 2 on page 2). 1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. [Ch 10 (loop). Miss next ch-10 sp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – sc2tog made. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc] 3 (4) times. Ch 10 (loop). Miss next ch-10 sp. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Turn. 2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc2tog. [Ch 10 (loop). Miss next ch-10 sp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc] 3 (4) times. Ch 10 (loop). Miss next ch-10 sp. Sc2tog. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. [Ch 10 (loop). Miss next ch-10 sp. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc] 3 (4) times. Ch 10 (loop). Miss next ch-10 sp. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn. 4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. [Ch 10 (loop). Miss next ch-10 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc] 3 (4) times. Ch 10 (loop). Miss next ch-10 sp. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn. 5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. [Ch 10 (loop). Miss next ch-10 sp. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts] 3 (4) times. Ch 10 (loop). Miss next ch-10 sp. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn. 6th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. [Ch 10 (loop). Miss next ch-10 sp. Draw up a loop in each of next 3 sc. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook - sc3tog made] 3 (4) times. Ch 10 (loop). Miss next ch-10 sp. Sc2tog. Turn. Chaining loops: (See Chart 3). Pick up ch-10 loops from 3rd and 4th rows and pull tog through ch-10 loops from 1st and 2nd rows. Pick up ch-10 loops from 5th and 6th rows and pull tog through ch-10 loops from 3rd and 4th rows. Pick up ch-10 loops from 7th and 8th rows and pull tog through ch-10 loops from 5th and 6th rows. Rep in same manner for all ch-10 loops as shown in picture. Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. (2 sc in 2 ch-10 loops formed after chaining. 1 sc in next st) 4 (5) times. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 11 (14) sc. Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. (Sc2tog) 5 (7) times. 1 sc in next 1 (0) sc. Fasten off. Sew seams 2½ (3¼)" [6 (8.5) cm] in from top and bottom edges for spout and handle openings. Flower: (See Chart 4). With D, ch 5. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring. 1st rnd: Ch 1. 10 sc in ring. Join with sl st to first sc. 2nd rnd: Working into front loops only, ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. Ch 3. Sl st in top of last sc – picot made. *1 sc in next sc. Picot. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. 3rd rnd: Join D with sl st to any rem loop of 1st rnd. Working in rem loops of 1st rnd, ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. (1 sc. Ch 15. 1 sc) in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. (5 ch-15 loops). 4th rnd: *(10 dc. Picot. 10 dc) in next ch-15 sp. Miss next sc. Sl st in next sc. Rep from * around. Fasten off. Sew Flower to top of Tea Cozy.

materials: RED HEART® Anne Geddes Baby™: 1 ball each of 100 Lily A, 203 Daffodil B, 504 Robin C, 702 Rosie D and 591 Posy E for Version 1 OR  1 ball each of 100 Lily A, 504 Robin C and 801 Bluebell F for Version 2
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook:  4mm [US G-6], 3.5mm [US E-4] and 3.25 [US D-3]
Folding fabric storage cube, 11” [28 cm] tall x 10½” [26.5 cm] wide x 10½” [26.5 cm] deep
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: 11” [28 cm] high x 10½” [26.5 cm] wide x 10½” [26.5 cm] deep
gauge: 17 sc = 4” [10cm]; 19 rows = 4” [10cm] in single crochet using 4mm [US G-6] hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
COZY
Bottom Piece
With A and 4mm [US G-6] hook, ch 4, slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 3, (counts as dc here and throughout), work 11 dc in ring, slip st in top of beginning ch to join – 12 dc. 
Round 2: Ch 3, *(2 dc, tr) in next dc, (tr, 2 dc) in next dc, dc in next dc; repeat from * twice more, (2 dc, tr) in dc, (tr, 2 dc) in next dc, slip st in top of beginning ch – 28 sts.
Round 3: Ch 3, dc in next 2 dc, *(2 dc, tr) in next tr, (tr, 2 dc) in next tr, dc in next 5 dc; repeat from * twice more, (2 dc, tr) in next tr, (tr, 2 dc) in next tr, dc in next 2 dc, slip st in top of beginning ch – 44 sts.
Round 4: Ch 3, dc in next 4 dc, *(2 dc, tr) in next tr, (tr, 2 dc) in next tr, dc in next 9 dc; repeat from * twice more, (2 dc, tr) in next tr, (tr, 2 dc) in next tr, dc in next 4 dc, slip st in top of beginning ch – 60 sts.
Round 5: Ch 3, dc in next 6 dc, *(2 dc, tr) in next tr, (tr, 2 dc) in next tr, dc in next 13 dc; repeat from * twice more, (2 dc, tr) in next tr, (tr, 2 dc) in next tr, dc in next 6 dc, slip st in top of beginning ch – 76 sts.
Round 6: Ch 3, dc in next 8 dc, *(2 dc, tr) in next tr, (tr, 2 dc) in next tr, dc in next 17 dc; repeat from * twice more, (2 dc, tr) in next tr, (tr, 2 dc) in next tr, dc in next 8 dc, slip st in top of beginning ch – 92 sts.
Round 7: Ch 3, dc in next 10 dc, *(2 dc, tr) in next tr, (tr, 2 dc) in next tr, dc in next 21 dc; repeat from * twice more, (2 dc, tr) in next tr, (tr, 2 dc) in next tr, dc in next 10 dc, slip st in top of beginning ch – 108 sts.
Round 8: Ch 3, dc in next 12 dc, *(2 dc, tr) in next tr, (tr, 2 dc) in next tr, dc in next 25 dc; repeat from * twice more, (2 dc, tr) in next tr, (tr, 2 dc) in next tr, dc in next 12 dc, slip st in top of beginning ch – 124 sts.
Round 9: Ch 3, dc in next 14 dc, *(2 dc, tr) in next tr, (tr, 2 dc) in next tr, dc in next 29 dc; repeat from * twice more, (2 dc, tr) in next tr, (tr, 2 dc) in next tr, dc in next 14 dc, slip st in top of beginning ch – 140 sts.
Fasten off.
Note
Make 1 each with A and B, C, D or E as contrasting color CC for Version 1 OR make 2 each with A and C and F as contrasting color CC for Version 2.
If desired, change to smaller hook on last rows for a tighter fit.
Side Panel
With A and 4mm [US G-6] hook, ch 40.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch – 39 sts.
Rows 2-3: Change to CC, ch 1, turn, sc in each st across.
Rows 4-5: Change to A, ch 1, turn, sc in each st across.
Rows 6-55: Continue to work in sc, alternating A and CC every 2 rows, end with 2 rows of CC. Fasten off. 
FINISHING
Side Panel Edging
With right side facing and 4mm [US G-6] hook, join A at side edge of Side Panel, sc 50 sts evenly spaced along edge. Fasten off. 
Repeat along opposite side edge. Repeat Edging along each side edge of each Side Panel. 
With stripes running horizontally and foundation ch of each Side Panel along edges of Bottom piece, join A at one corner, working through both layers, sc lower edge of Side Panels and Bottom piece together. Fasten off. 
For Version 2, alternate C and F Side Panels. 
With right side facing and 4mm [US G-6] hook, join A at side edge of two Side Panels, working through both layers, sc side edges together, taking care to line up stripes. Fasten off. Repeat to join all sides.
Top Edging
Round 1: With 3.5mm [US E-4] hook, join A in any st along top edge, ch 1, sc in same st and in each st around, working 1 st in each side seam, slip st in first sc to join – 160 sts.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in same st and in each st around.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in same st and in next 7 sts, sc2tog, *sc in next 8 sc, sc2tog; repeat from * 15 times, slip st in first sc – 144 sts.
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in same st and in each st around, slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Weave in ends.
Thread a length of elastic thread around top of Cozy to pull in. Cut and knot ends.
Sew a button in each corner and in center of each side along top edge of Cozy for Pennant Bunting.
PENNANT BUNTING 
Make 8 
With 3.5mm [US E-4] hook and A, ch 24. 
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across – 23 sts. 
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across. 
Decrease Row: Ch 1, turn, skip first st, sc in each st to last 2 sts, sc2tog – 21 sts.
Next Row: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across. 
Repeat last 2 rows until 3 sts remain. 
Last Row: Ch 1, turn, skip first st, sc2tog. 
Fasten off.
Edging Round: With 3.5mm [US E-4] hook, join A in first ch along opposite edge of foundation ch, ch 8, slip st in same st for button loop, sc in each ch across, ch 8, slip st in same st for button loop, turn to work along side edge, sc 20 sts evenly spaced along edge to last st, 3 sc in point, turn to work along opposite side edge, sc 20 sts evenly spaced along opposite side edge, slip st to first st. Fasten off. 
Bunny or Bear Head 
Make 8 Bunnies or Bears; 2 each in B, C, D and E 
With 3.25 [US D-3] hook, ch 4. 
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, 2 sc in next ch, sc in last ch – 4 sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in first st, 2 sc in next 2 sts, sc in last st – 6 sts.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 4 sts, 2 sc in last st – 8 sts.
Row 4: Ch 1, turn, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 6 sts, 2 sc in last st – 10 sts.
Rows 5-7: Sc in each st across.
Row 8: Ch 1, turn, skip first st, sc in each st to last 2 sts, sc2tog – 8 sts.
Row 9: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 2 sts, [sc2tog] twice, sc in last 2 sts – 6 sts.
Row 10: Ch 1, turn, skip first st, sc in next 3 sts, sc2tog – 4 sts.
Edging Round: Sc evenly spaced around edges to first st, slip st in first sc. Fasten off. 
Bunny Ears
Make 2 for each Bunny
With same color and 3.25 [US D-3] hook, ch 5. 
Round 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and next 2 ch, 5 hdc in last ch, turn to work opposite edge of foundation ch, sc in next 3 ch, slip st to first sc to join. 
Fasten off. 
Bear Ears
Make 2 for each Bear
With same color and 3.25 [US D-3] hook, ch 2.
Round 1: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook, slip st in first sc. Fasten off. 
Muzzle
Make 8
With A and 3.25 [US D-3] hook, ch 4.
Round 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and next ch, 3 sc in last ch, turn to work opposite edge of foundation ch, sc in next 2 ch, slip st to first sc to join. 
Fasten off. 
FINISHING
Using black embroidery thread and following photograph, work nose on Muzzle in satin st. Sew Muzzle to Bunny or Bear face. Embroider eyes on face. Sew Ears in place.  Sew a Bunny or Bear Head in center of each Pennant. Button each Pennant on Cozy.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Contrast A Carrot (0256) 1 ball or 128 yds/117 m
Size U.S. H/8 [5 mm] Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Susan Bates® split ring stitch markers
Small quantities [5 yds (4.5 m) each] of Black (0312) and White (0311)
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Scbl = Single crochet in back loop only of next stitch
measurements: Approx 9½" [24 cm] wide x 4" [10 cm] tall to fit 12 oz soda can.
gauge: 12 hdc and 11 rows = 4" [10 cm] with two strands of yarn. 14 sc and 20 rows = 4" [10 cm] with one strand of yarn.
instructions:
Notes:
• Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st.
• Lining is worked holding 2 strands of yarn tog throughout.
• Work loosely so that inside cup has a little stretch.
• Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
• Ch 2 at beg of rnds does not count as st.
Lining
With A, ch 2.
See Diagram on page 3.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next sc. 1 hdc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 18 hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 hdc.
5th rnd: Ch 2. Working in back loops only, 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join.
6th to 12th rnds: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join. Fasten off.
Ball
Notes:
• Ball is worked in continuous rnds without joining or turning. Use a st marker to mark beg of each rnd, moving up as work progresses.
• Using 1 strand of A, hold Liner with top facing and join yarn with sl st to any back loop of 12th rnd of Lining.
See Diagram on page 3.
1st rnd: *Scbl in next st. 2 scbl in next st. Rep from * around. 36 sts.
2nd rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
3rd rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. 48 sc.
4th rnd: As 2nd rnd.
5th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 60 sc.
6th to 13th rnds: As 2nd rnd.
14th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. 48 sts.
15th rnd: As 2nd rnd.
16th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. 36 sts.
17th rnd: As 2nd rnd. Begin stuffing to create round ball shape. Stuff firmly to define shape but do not overstuff or stretch sts (this helps prevent stuffing from showing through work). It may be helpful to place a soda can inside the Lining to hold its shape while working. Cont stuffing as you close.
18th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 24 sts.
Joining rnd: Place Lining inside Ball and join 18th rnd of Ball to unworked loops from 5th rnd of Lining with 1 rnd of sc, working through both thicknesses. Fasten off.
Hoop and Net
See Diagram on page 3.
With Black, ch 8. Join with sl st to form ring. Fasten off, leaving 10" [25 cm] tail for sewing.
Join White with sl st to any ch on ring.
1st rnd: Ch 4. (Skip next ch. Sl st in next ch) 3 times. Ch 4. Join with sl st to first sl st of rnd. 4 ch-4 loops.
2nd rnd: Sl st in each of first 2 ch. (Ch 4. Sl st in next loop) 3 times. Ch 4. Join with sl st to first loop.
3rd rnd: (Ch 3. Sl st in next loop) 3 times. Ch 3. Join with sl st in first loop. Fasten off, leaving a long tail.
FINISHING
Use photo as a guide for finishing. With scrap yarn, outline an oval on each side of the Ball using Running Stitch.
RUNNING STITCH
BACK STITCH
With Black, embroider the oval outline using Back Stitch. Bisect each oval lengthwise with another line of back stitches. Remove scrap yarn.
With Black, embroider eyes 1/3 of the way down face, approx 3 or 4 sts apart using Satin Stitch.
With Black embroider a V-smile and eyebrows using Back Stitch as shown in photo.
Position Hoop on left side of face. With Black sew back of Hoop to Ball. Fasten off. With White, sew back of Net to Ball. Fasten off and weave in ends.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Classic Crochet Thread, Size 10: 1 ball 001 White
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Cozy measures 11” [28 cm] long x 9.5” wide [24 cm]
gauge: 8 shells = 4” [10 cm]; 5 rounds = 4” [10 cm] in shells pattern. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Bridal Bouquet Cozy
Perfect for bride and her bride’s maids, this lacy crocheted cozy is lovely for carrying a bouquet down the aisle. Start at the lower edge with a circle of dainty crocheted flowers and work your way up to a wider ruffle that encircles the blossoms.

Round 4: Slip st in first ch-5 loop, ch 3, 13 dc in same loop, * slip st in next ch-5 loop, ch 5, slip st in next ch-5 loop **, 14 dc in next ch-5 loop; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; join in top of ch-3.

Round 5: Ch 3, dc in next 13 dc, * slip st in next ch-5 loop, dc in next 14 dc; repeat from * around; slip st in next ch-5 loop; join in top of ch-3.

Round 6: Skip ch-3 and dc, slip st in next dc, * [ch 5, dc in same dc, skip 2 dc, slip st in next dc] 3 times, ch 3, dc in same dc **, skip next 4 dc, slip st in next dc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; join in first slip st. Fasten off.

TOP
Work along opposite side of Round 1 of Bottom Edging. With right side facing, attach thread with slip st in any tr loop.

Round 1 (Right Side): Beginning shell in first tr loop, shell in each tr loop around; join in top of ch-3 – 9 shells.

Round 2: Slip st in ch-2 space, beginning shell in same space, shell in shell around; join in top of ch-3.

Rounds 3-11: Repeat Round 2.

Round 12: Slip st in ch-2 space, beginning shell inc in same space, shell inc in ch-2 space of each shell around; join in top of ch-3.

Round 13: Slip st in ch-2 space, beginning shell in same space, shell in each ch-2 space around; join in top of ch-3 – 18 shells.

Round 14: Slip st in ch-2 space, beginning shell in same space, * ch 2, shell in shell; repeat from * around; ch 2; join in top of ch-3.

Round 15: Repeat Round 14.

Round 16: Slip st in ch-2 space, beginning shell in same space, * ch 3, shell in shell; repeat from * around; ch 3; join in top of ch-3.

Round 17: Repeat Round 16.

Round 18: Slip st in ch-2 space, * ch 5, slip st in next ch-3 space **, ch 5, slip st in ch-2 space of next shell; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; ch 5; slip st in base of beginning ch-5 – 36 loops.

Rounds 19- 21: Repeat Rounds 4-6 of Bottom Edging.

FINISHING
Fasten off and weave in ends. Optional: Wrap Cozy with the ribbon and tie ends in a bow.

COZY
Bottom Edging
Round 1 (Right Side): [Ch 5, tr in 5th ch from hook] 9 times; being careful not to twist, join with slip st in base of beginning ch-5 – 9 ch-5 loops.

Round 2: Slip st in first ch-5 loop, ch 1, 5 sc in same loop; * [ch 5, slip st in next ch-5 loop] 2 times **, ch 5, 5 sc in next ch-5 loop; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; ch 5; join in beginning sc.

Round 3: Skip first 2 sc, slip st in next sc, (ch 8, dc) in same sc, * slip st in next ch-5 loop, [ch 5, slip st in next ch-5 loop] 2 times **, skip 2 sc, (dc, ch 5, dc) in next sc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; join in 3rd ch of beginning ch-8.

Special Stitches
beginning shell = (ch 3, dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in same space.
shell = (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in same space.
shell in shell = (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in ch-2 space of next shell.
beginning shell inc (beginning shell increase) = (ch 3, dc, ch 2, 2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in same space.
shell inc (shell increase) = (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in same space.

Note:
The Bottom Edging is worked first, then the Top is worked into the opposite side of the treble crochet loops made in Round 1.

materials: RED HEART® Soft®: 1 ball 4422 Tangerine A, small amount 4614 Black B and 4601 Off White C for Jack-O-Lantern
RED HEART® Soft®: 1 ball 9522 Leaf D, small amount 4614 Black B, 9925 Really Red E and 4601 Off White C for Frankenstein
RED HEART® Soft®: 1 ball 4601 Off White C and small amount 4614 Black B for Ghostie
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
measurements: Cozy stretches to fit most sizes of coffee shop cups.
gauge: 24 sts = 5” (13 cm); 17 rows = 4” (10 cm) in sc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
With D, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 4 sc in 2nd ch from hook, slip st in first sc to join.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in back loop of each sc around, slip st in first sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Sew Nose to center front of Cozy.
Ear (Make 2)
With D, ch 4.
Row 1: Work 6 dc in 4th ch from hook.
Fasten off, leaving long tail for sewing. Sew one Ear to each side of Cozy.
Eye (Make 2)
With B, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook, slip st in first sc to join.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Sew Eyes to front of Cozy. With C, embroider a highlight in each eye.
Mouth
With E, ch 17.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Tack chain to Cozy in a crooked “W” shape for Mouth.
Hair
Cut 1” (3 cm) lengths of B and attach to center top of Cozy. Trim to ½” (2 cm) for Hair.
Cozy
With A for Jack-O-Lantern, D for Frankenstein or C for Ghostie, ch 13.
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn – 12 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in back loop only of each sc across, turn.
Repeat Row 2 until piece measures 8” (20 cm) from beginning, end with a wrong side row. Do NOT fasten off.
Joining Row: With wrong side facing and short edges aligned and working through top of last row and remaining loop of foundation ch, ch 1, slip st in each st across.
Fasten off.
Finishing
Jack-O-Lantern
Eyes (Make 2)
With B, ch 4.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, hdc in next ch, dc in last ch.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Sew Eyes to front of Cozy. With C, embroider a small highlight in each Eye.
Mouth
With B, ch 13.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, hdc in next ch, dc in each of next 8 ch, hdc in next ch, sc in last sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Curve Mouth into a smile and sew in place.
Mouth
With B, ch 4.
Round 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next ch, 3 sc in next ch, turn to work along opposite side of foundation ch, sc in next ch, 2 sc in next ch, slip st to first sc to join.
Fasten off, leaving a 12” (30 cm) end long tail for sewing. Sew Mouth to Cozy centered under Eyes.
Weave in ends.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (Solids: 70.9 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds)
Size 5 mm (U.S. H/8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
measurements: Approx 16 inches [40.5 centimetres] circumference.
gauge: 13 single crochets and 14 rows = 4 inches [10 centimeters].
instructions:
• When joining colors, work to last 2 loops on hook of first color. Draw new color through last 2 loops and proceed.
• When joining a new color, leave a tail approximately 4 inches [10 centimeters] long to ensure you are left with enough yarn to weave in your end.
(Make 2 pieces alike).
With A, chain 30.

1st row: 1 single crochet in 2nd chain from hook. *Chain 1. Skip next chain. 1 single crochet in next chain. Repeat from * to end of chain. Turn. (You should have 15 single crochet and 14 chain-1 spaces at end of row).
2nd row: Chain 1. 1 single crochet in first single crochet. *1 single crochet in next chain 1 space. Chain (ch) 1. Skip next sc. Repeat from * 12 times more. 1 single crochet in next chain 1 space. 1 single crochet in last single crochet. Join B (see note). Turn. (You should have 16 single crochet and 13 chain-1 spaces at end of row).
3rd row: With B, ch 1. 1 single crochet (sc) in first sc. *Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next chain 1 space (ch-1 sp). Repeat (rep) from * to last 2 stitches. Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. (You should have 15 sc and 14 ch-1 spaces at end of row).
4th row: As 2nd row. Join A (see note). Turn.
5th row: With A, as 3rd row.
Repeat 2nd to 5th rows for pattern until work from beginning measures 8 inches [20.5 centimeters] ending with 2 rows of either color.
Fasten off. Weave in ends.
Ties: Along side of work, join A with slip stitch 1½ inches [4 centimeters] down from top edge. Chain 20. Fasten off. Along side of work, join A with slip stitch 1½ inches [4 centimeters] up from bottom edge. Chain 20. Fasten off. Repeat on opposite side.

materials: Red Heart® Celebration™: 3 balls 9340 Aqua/Silver A
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Cake Cover measures 12” (30.4 cm) tall (including ruffle).
gauge: 7 sc = 2” (5 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain gauge.
instructions:
Body
With A, ch 126. 
Round 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across, join with slip st in first sc—125 sc.
Round 2: Sc in each sc around—125 sc.
Rounds 3–22: Repeat Round 2—125 sc.
Round 23: [Sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog] around—100 sc.
Round 24: Repeat Round 2—100 sc.
Round 25: [Sc in next 8 sc, sc2tog] around—90 sc.
Round 26: Repeat Round 2—90 sc.
Round 27: Repeat Round 25—81 sc.
Rounds 28–43: Repeat Round 2, fasten off at end of last round—81 sc.
Flat Circle/Body Join
With right side facing, holding last rounds of 1 Flat Circle and Body together, working through both pieces, join C with slip st in any st, reverse sc in same st as join and in each remaining st around, fasten off—81 reverse sc.
Bottom Ruffles
With right side facing, join C with slip st in any loop on opposite side of foundation of Body.
Round 1: Ch 4, (tr, ch 1, tr) in same st as beginning ch-4, (tr, ch 1, tr) in each remaining st around, fasten off.
Center Rose (Make 1)
With B, leaving a 6” (15.2 cm) tail, ch 24.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across, turn—23 sc.
Row 2: [Ch 3, skip next sc, sc in next sc] across, turn—12 ch-3 spaces.
Row 3: Ch 3, (3 dc, ch 3, slip st) in first space (petal), [ch 3, (3 dc, ch 3, slip st) in next space] across, fasten off—12 petals.
CAKE COVER
Flat Circle (Make 2)
With A, ch 5, join with slip st in first ch to form ring.
Round 1: 6 sc in ring, place marker—6 sc.
Round 2: 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] around—18 sc.
Round 4: Sc in each sc around—18 sc.
Round 5: 2 sc in each sc around—36 sc.
Round 6: Repeat Round 4—36 sc.
Round 7: Repeat Round 3—54 sc.
Round 8: Repeat Round 4—54 sc.
Round 9: [Sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc] around—63 sc.
Round 10: Repeat Round 4—63 sc.
Round 11: [Sc in next 6 sc, 2 sc in next sc] around—72 sc.
Round 12: Repeat Round 4—72 sc.
Round 13: [Sc in next 7 sc, 2 sc in next sc] around—81 sc.
Round 14: Repeat Round 4, fasten off—81 sc.
Small Rose (Make 9)
With B, leaving a 6” (15.2 cm) tail, ch 16.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across, turn—15 sc.
Row 2: [Ch 3, skip next sc, sc in next sc] across, turn—8 ch-3 spaces.
Row 3: Ch 3, (3 dc, ch 3, slip st) in first space (petal), [ch 3, (3 dc, ch 3, slip st) in next space] across, fasten off—8 petals.
Leaf (Make 5)
With C, leaving 6” (15.2 cm) tail, ch 10.
Row 1: Dc in 3rd ch from hook and in next 2 chs, sc in next 2 chs, (sc, ch 3, sc) in next ch, working in remaining loops across, sc in next 2 chs, dc in next 3 chs. Fasten off.
Vine
With C, ch 3.
Row 1: Hdc in 3rd ch from hook, *hdc in side bar of first hdc, repeat from * until Vine is 45” (114.3 cm) long. Fasten off.
Assembly
1. Leaving 16 sc between each point, drape and sew Vine to Round 21 of Body. (5 points) Roll 1 Small Rose and stitch in shape using 6” (15.2 cm) tail. Use remainder of tail to stitch to each point where Vine is attached to Body.
2. Stitch 1 Leaf to center of assembled Flat Circle. Roll Center Rose and stitch in shape using 6” (15.2 cm) tail. Place Center Rose over stitched Leaf, and use remainder of tail to stitch to center of Flat Circle.
3. Leaving 15 sc between each Leaf, sew remaining Leaves to Rounds 10 and 11 of same Flat Circle. Roll remaining Small Roses and stitch in shape using 6” (15.2 cm) tails. Place 1 Small Rose over stitched each Leaf, and use remainder of tail to stitch to Flat Circle.
4. Turn Cake Cover inside out. Place remaining Flat Circle against wrong side of assembled Flat Circle. Sew remaining Flat Circle in place, stuffing as you go to create a rounded top. Fasten off and weave in all ends.

materials: Patons® shetland Chunky (100 g/3.5 oz; 136 m/148 yds)
Version I Main Color (MC) (78024 Biscuit) 1 ball
Contrast B (78609 High Plains Variegated) 1 ball
Version II Main Color (MC) (78736 Oriental Orchid) 1 ball
Size 6 mm (U.S. J or 10) crochet hook or size needed to obtain tension.
measurements: To fit 6-8 cup teapot.
gauge: 11 sc and 12 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Front 
note: Ch 3 at beg of row counts as dc throughout.
Beg at bottom edge, with MC, ch 27. 
1st row: (RS). 5 dc in 6th ch from hook. (Miss next 5 ch. 5 dc in next ch) 
3 times. Miss next 2 ch. 1 dc in last ch. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3. 2 dc in first dc. *Miss next 5 dc. Working behind row, 5 dc 
in 3rd ch of next missed ch-5 group from 2 rows below. Rep from * twice 
more. Miss next 5 dc. 3 dc last dc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3. Miss next 2 dc. *Working behind row, 5 dc in center dc of 
next 5 dc group from 2 rows below.** Miss next 5 dc. Rep from * twice 
more, then rep from * to ** once more. Miss next 2 dc. 1 dc in last dc. 
Turn.
4th row: Ch 3. 2 dc in first dc. *Miss next 5 dc. Working in front of row 
through to back of work, 5 dc in center dc of next 5 dc group from 2 rows 
below. Rep from * twice more. Miss next 5 dc. 3 dc last dc. Turn.
5th row: Ch 3. Miss next 2 dc. *Working in front of row, 5 dc in center 
dc of next 5 dc group from 2 rows below.** Miss next 5 dc. Rep from * 
twice more, then rep from * to ** once more. Miss next 2 dc. 1 dc in last 
dc. Turn.
6th row: Ch 3. 2 dc in same sp. *Miss next 5 dc. Working behind row 
through to front of work, 5 dc in center dc of next 5 dc group from 2 rows 
below. Rep from * twice more. Miss next 5 dc. 3 dc last dc. Turn.
7th to 18th rows: Rep 3rd to 6th rows 3 times more.
19th row: Ch 3. *Working behind row, 3 dc in center dc of next 5 dc 
group from 2 rows below. Working in current row, 1 hdc in center of next 
5 dc group. Rep from * twice more. Miss next 2 dc. 1 dc in last dc. Fasten 
off.
edging: 1st row: (RS). Join B with sl st at bottom right corner. Ch 1. 
Work 27 sc up side of work. *(1 hdc. 1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc. 1 hdc) in corner st.* 
Work 8 sc evenly across top edge. Rep from * to * once more. Work 27 sc 
down side of work. Turn. 72 sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 29 sts. (1 hdc. 1 dc. 1 hdc) in ch-1 sp. 
1 sc in each of next 12 sts. (1 hdc. 1 dc. 1 hdc) in ch-1 sp. 1 sc in each of 
next 29 sts. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 30 sts. Place marker on 18th st. 3 sc 
in next dc. 1 sc in each of next 14 sts. 3 sc in next dc. 1 sc in each of next 
30 sts. Fasten off.
Back 
With B, work as Front, omitting all references to color changes.
eye Mask
With A, ch 13.
1st rnd: 5 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 6 dc). Miss next 2 ch. 1 sc in 
each of next 4 ch. Miss next 2 ch. 12 dc in last ch. Working into opposite 
side of ch, miss next 2 ch. 1 sc in each of next 4 ch. 6 dc in next ch. Miss 
next 2 ch. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each of next 3 dc. 1 sc in each of next 10 sts. 2 sc 
in each of next 6 dc. 1 sc in each of next 2 dc. (Draw up a loop in each of 
next 3 sts. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – sc3tog made) twice. 
1 sc in each of next 2 dc. 2 sc in each of next 3 dc. Join with sl st to first 
sc. Fasten off.
eyes (make 2).
With D, ch 2.
1st rnd: (4 sc. 2 hdc. 3 dc. 2 hdc) in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to 
first sc. Fasten off.
Beak
With C, ch 5.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. 4 sc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. (Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sts. Yoh and draw through 
all loops on hook - sc2tog made) twice. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Fasten off.
FInIshInG
Sew eyes, Beak and buttons to eye Mask as shown. Sew eye Mask to 
Front as shown in picture.
top joining row: With WS of Back and Front pieces tog and Front facing, 
join B with sl st at marker. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, 1 sl st 
in each of next 43 sc. Fasten off. 
Sew Front and Back tog at bottom corners, leaving openings for spout 
and handle.
tassel: (make 2). 
Cut B, 4" [10 cm] long. Take 6 strands tog, fold in half and knot into 
fringe at each corner sc at top edge of Cozy. Trim fringe evenly.

materials: RED HEART® “Soft Touch”: 2 (3, 3) balls 4614 Black A.
RED HEART® Boutique™ “Sashay™”: 2 (2, 2) balls 1912 Hip Hop B.
abbreviations: A and B = Colour A, and Colour B
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
*= repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Finished Width (at lower edge): 104 (114, 122) cm (42 (45, 48)” Finished Length: 33 (34, 35) cm (13 (13½, 14)”
gauge: 1 ripple (measured from valley to valley) = 9 cm (3½)”; 6½ rows = 10 cm (4”) in ripple st pattern at lower edge.
instructions:
COZY
With A, ch 133 (143, 153).
Row 1 (Foundation Row – Right Side): Dc in 3rd ch from hook (beginning ch counts as first dc), dc in next 3 ch, dc3tog, dc in next 3 ch, *3 dc in next ch, dc in next 3 ch, dc3tog, dc in next 3 ch; repeat from * to last ch, 2 dc in last ch, turn—131 (141, 151) sts
Row 2 (Pattern Row): Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in first dc, dc in next 3 dc, dc3tog, dc in next 3 dc, *3 dc in next dc, dc in next 3 dc, dc3tog, dc in next 3 dc; repeat from * to beginning ch, 2 dc in top of beginning ch, turn.
Row 3 (Ruffle Row): This row is worked with both A and B, work Row 2 and attach B, as follows: Hold cozy with Right Side facing. Unwind a length of B, hold B with metallic edge at bottom, ball on the left and a long beginning tail on the right (long beginning tail is to be tacked to Wrong Side later). *Yo with A , insert hook through a hole at top edge of B and then into the next st to be worked, yo with A and draw through st and then through B, yo with A and complete the st as usual. Skip next hole in B; repeat from * to end of row, inserting hook in every other hole of B and working sts as in Row 2 (Pattern Row). Cut B, leaving a long tail to tack to Wrong Side.
Rows 4–8: With A only, repeat Row 2 five times.
Row 9 (Ruffle Row): With A and B, repeat Row 3.
Rows 10–15: Repeat Rows 4–9.
Row 16: With A only, repeat Row 2.
Shape Shoulders
Notes
1. Five stitches need to be decreased evenly spaced across each of the next 5 rows.
2. Decreases are worked in the dc3tog valleys. To decrease while maintaining the ripple pattern, a dc4tog is worked instead of a dc3tog, and then fewer dc stitches are worked to reach the next peak (the center of the next 3-dc group).
3. Markers are used to indicate the 5 valleys in which decreases will be worked. Move the markers to new locations before each decrease row, to spread out the decreases evenly over the rows.
4. Use of markers is optional. If you do not wish to use markers, remember to work dc4tog instead of dc3tog over 5 evenly spaced valleys and take care to work fewer dc stitches to the next peak, so that peaks are kept aligned over peaks and valleys are aligned over valleys.
5. Work Rows 17–20 with A only. Work Row 21 with A and B.
Place one marker in each of 5 dc3tog valleys. Space the markers evenly across the row.
Row 17 (Decrease Row): Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in first dc, dc in each dc to 1 st before the next valley, if the valley is marked work a dc4tog, if it is not marked work a dc3tog, dc in each dc to center dc of next 3-dc group (peak), *3 dc in center dc of 3-dc group, dc in each dc to 1 st before the next valley, if the valley is marked work a dc4tog, if it is not marked work a dc3tog, dc in each dc to center dc of next 3-dc group; repeat from * to beginning ch, 2 dc in top of beginning ch, turn—126 (136, 146) sts. 
Move the markers to 5 different valleys.
Rows 18–20: Repeat Row 17 three more times—111 (121, 131) sts.
Row 21: With A and B, repeat Row 17 attaching B as in Row 3 of lower section—106 (116, 126) sts.
FINISHING
Fold cut ends of the B ruffles to the Wrong Side and, with A, tack in place. Sew side edges of cozy together, from right side for back seam.
Top Edging
With Right Side facing, join A with sc in top edge at back seam, sc evenly spaced around top edge; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Weave in all ends.

materials: Bernat® Super ValueTM (7 oz/197 g; 426 yds/389 m)
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: To fit medium Tea Pot (4 cups) approx 5" [12.5 cm] tall.
gauge: 15 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Tea Cosy is worked sideways.
Make 2 pieces alike.
With A, ch 24 loosely.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 
1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 
23 sc.
**2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc.
*Draw up a loop in next st. Ch 4. 
Yoh and draw through 2 loops on 
hook – Popcorn st made. 1 sc in 
next sc. Rep from * to end of row. 
Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to 
end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 
2 sts. *Popcorn st. 1 sc in next sc. 
Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 sc in each 
of last 2 sts. Turn.
5th row: As 3rd row.
Rep 2nd to 4th rows once more. 
Break A. Join B.
Work 5th row once more. 
Work 2nd to 5th rows once, then 
2nd to 4th rows once. 
Break B. Join A.**
Work from ** to ** once more. 
Do not break B at end of last rep. 
Next row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in 
each st to end of row. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Top 
With RS of work facing, join B with 
sl st to top edge. Ch 1. Work 
18 sc across each piece to join them. 
Join with sl st to first sc. 36 sc. 
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to 
end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Next rnd: Ch 1. *Miss next sc. 1 sc 
in next sc. Rep from * around. Join 
with sl st to first sc.
Rep last 2 rnds once more. 9 sc rem. 
Fasten off, leaving a long end. 
Weave end through rem 9 sts 
tightly and fasten securely.
Pompom (make 1 with A and 
2 with B).
Wind yarn around 3 fingers approx
60 times. Remove from fingers and
tie tightly in center. Cut through each
side of loops. Trim to a smooth
round shape.
Sew side seams, leaving openings for
handle and spout. Attach pompoms
to top of Cosy.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: Cozy 1: 1 skein each 313 Aran A and 385 Royal B
Cozy 2: 1 skein each 356 Amethyst A and 313 Aran B
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Cozy measures 9½” (24 cm) in circumference and 3¼” (8 cm) tall.
gauge: 12 sts = 4” (10 cm); 12 rows = 4” (10 cm) in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
NOTES
Row gauge is not critical. When changing colors, do not cut yarn between rounds. Instead, pull up a large loop and place it in back of work. When starting a new round, tighten the loop before making the chain 1 to begin the round.

COZY
With A, ch 28. Join with a slip st to form a ring.
Round 1: Sc in each ch around.
Round 2: Ch 1 (does not count as st here and throughout), *(sc, ch 1, sc) in next st, skip 1 st; repeat from * to end, join with a slip st to first sc – 14 [sc, ch 1, sc] groups.
Round 3: Attach B with a slip st in middle of first (sc, ch 1, sc) group, leaving A’s loop hanging in back of work (see Note); ch 1, *(sc, ch 1, sc) in each ch-1 space; repeat from * to end, join with a slip st to first sc.
Round 4: Pick up A’s loop and pull through first ch-1 space; ch 1, *(sc, ch 1, sc) in each ch-1 space; repeat from * to end, join with a slip st to first sc.
Round 5: Pick up B’s loop and pull through first ch-1 space; ch 1, *(sc, ch 1, sc) in each ch-1 space; repeat from * to end, join with a slip st to first sc.
Repeat Rounds 4-5 until cozy measures 2¾" (7 cm), ending with Round 5.

Edging
Round 1: Pick up A’s loop and pull through first sc; *sc in next sc, skip ch-1 space, sc in next sc; repeat from * to end – 28 sc. Fasten off.

FINISHING
With yarn needle, weave in loose ends.

materials: Size 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain tension.
measurements: TENSION: 14 sc and 15 rows = 4 ins [10 cm].
instructions:
PANSY MOTIFS
Pansy I (Make 6)
With A, ch 4. Join with sl st to form a ring.
1st rnd:Ch 1. (2 sc in ring. Ch 2) 5 times. Join
with sl st to first sc. Break A.
2nd rnd: Join B with sl st to any ch 2 sp. Ch 2. (2 hdc.
Ch 3. 1 sl st in first ch – Picot made. 3 hdc) all in
same ch 2 sp. [Miss next sc. 1 sc in next sc. (3 hdc.
Picot. 3 hdc) all in next ch 2 sp] twice. [Miss next sc.
1 sc in next sc. (1 hdc. 9 dc. 1 hdc) all in next ch 2 sp]
twice. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Join with sl st to
top of ch 2. Fasten off.
Pansy II (Make 3)
Work as given for Pansy I substituting A for B and
B for A.
With yellow yarn, embroider center of Pansy using
bullion st as illustrated.
TEA COZY
Note: To change color, work to last 2 loops on
hook. Draw loop in next color through 2 loops on
hook to complete st and proceed in next color.
Make 2 pieces alike.
With MC, ch 38.
1st row:(RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as
2 dc). 1 dc in each ch to end of ch. 36 dc. Turn.
2nd row:Ch 1. 1 sc in each dc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc.
*[Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st
2 rows below inserting hook from right to left.
(Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice- 
1 dcfp made] 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep
from * to last 5 sc. (1 dcfp) 3 times. 1 sc in each of
last 2 sc. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows 9 times more.
Shape Top: 1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc.
*(1 dcfp) 3 times. 1 sc in next sc. * Yoh and draw
up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw
through all 3 loops on hook - sc2tog made. 1 sc in
next sc. Rep from * to last 5 sc. (1 dcfp) 3 times.
1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn.
2nd and alt rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of
row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *(1 dcfp)
3 times. 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog over next 2 sts. Rep
from * to last 5 sc. (1 dcfp) 3 times. Sc2tog over last
2 sts. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sts. *(1 dcfp) 
3 times. Sc2tog over next 2 sts. Rep from * to last
4 sc. (1 dcfp) 3 times. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
7th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *(1 dcfp) 3 times.
Miss next sc. Rep from * to last 4 sc. (1 dcfp) 3 times.
1 sc in last sc. Turn.
9th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *(Yoh and draw up
a loop around post of next st 2 rows below
inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw
through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw
through all 3 loops on hook- 1 dcfp2tog made.
Rep from * to last st. 1 sc in last st. Fasten off.
Sew Front and Back tog leaving openings for spout
and handle.
Sew Pansy Motifs at top of Tea Cosy as illustrated.
Bullion
St Diagram

materials: RED HEART® “Eco-Cotton™ Blend”: 2 Balls each 1645 Moss A and 1370 Candy Marl B.
Swivel clasp, 1” steel ring or key ring, yarn needle.
abbreviations: A, B, C = color A, B, C
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Bib measures 17” x 7” (including straps). Tall Bottle Cozy measures 7” circumference x 6” tall (excluding strap). Short Bottle Cozy measures 10” circumference x 3 ½” tall (excluding strap).
gauge: 23 sts = 4”; 14 rows = 4” in pattern st. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Note: Work in back loops only throughout unless otherwise stated. Stripe Sequence: Working in pattern st, work 2 rows with A, 2 rows with B. Repeat last 4 rows for Stripe Sequence. 
BIB
With A, ch 41.
Row 1 (Right Side): Working in back loops only, sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next ch, work 3 sc in next ch, sc in next 2 ch, *skip 2 ch, sc in next 2 ch, 3 sc in next ch, sc in next 2 ch; repeat from * across.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in first st, skip next st, sc in next st, 3 sc in next st, *sc in next 2 sts, skip 2 sts, sc in next 2 sts, 3 sc in next st; repeat from * to last 3 sts, sc in next st, skip next st, sc in last st.
Working in Stripe Sequence and carrying color not in use along side of work, repeat Row 2 until 24 rows have been worked. 
Left Tie
Row 25 (Right Side): Working in back loops only and keeping in Stripe Sequence, ch 1, sc in first st, skip next st, sc in next st, *3 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts, skip 2 sts, sc in each of next 2 sts; repeat from * once more, slip st in next st, leave remaining sts unworked for Right Shoulder Tie.
Row 26: Turn, skip slipped st, sc in next st, skip next st, sc in next st, 3 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts, skip 2 sts, sc in next 2 sts, 3 sc in next st, sc in next st, skip next st, sc in last st.
Row 27: Ch 1, turn, sc in first st, skip next st, sc in next st, 3 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts, skip 2 sts, sc in next 2 sts, leave remaining sts unworked.
Row 28: Ch 1, turn, skip 3 sts, sc in next 2 sts, 3 sc in next st, sc in next st, skip next st, sc in last st.
Row 29: Ch 1, turn, sc in first st, skip next st, sc in next st, 3 sc in next st, sc in next st, skip next st, sc in next st.
Rows 30-61: Keeping in Stripe Sequence, repeat Row 29.
Fasten off. 
Right Tie
Row 25 (Right Side): With right side facing, skip next 14 sts along Row 24 of Bib. Keeping in Stripe Sequence and working in back loops only, join A with slip st in next st, sc in next 2 sts, 3 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts, skip 2 sts, sc in next 2 sts, 3 sc in next st, sc in next st, skip next st, sc in last st.
Row 26: Ch 1, turn, sc in first st, skip next st, sc in next st, 3 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sts, skip 2 sts, sc in next 2 sts, place marker in last st made, 2 sc in next st, sc in next st, slip st in next st. 
Fasten off A.
Row 27: With right side facing, join B with sc in marked st, sc in next st, skip 2 sts, sc in next 2 sts, 3 sc in next st, sc in next st, skip next st, sc in last st, turn.
Row 28: Ch 1, turn, sc in first st, skip next st, sc in next st, 3 sc in next st, sc in each of next 2 sts, place marker in last st made, skip next st, slip st in next st. 
Fasten off B.
Row 29: With right side facing, join A with sc in marked st, skip next st, sc in next st, 3 sc in next st, sc in next st, skip next st, sc in last st.
Row 30: Ch 1, turn, sc in first st, skip next st, sc in next st, 3 sc in next st, sc in next st, skip next st, sc in last st.
Rows 31-61: Keeping in Stripe Sequence, repeat Row 30. 
Fasten off. 
FINISHING
Edging
Row 1: With right side facing, join A with sc in side of Row 1, work 61 sc in evenly spaced along edges of rows to last row of Tie, work 7 sts across Tie as established, work 39 sts evenly spaced along edge of Tie to 14 center sts, work across 14 sts as established, work 39 along opposite Tie, work 7 sts across Tie as established, work 61 sts evenly spaced along edge Bib to Row 1. 
Fasten off. 
BOTTLE COZY
Instructions are written for Tall Bottle Cozy with Short Bottle Cozy in parentheses.
Body
With A, ch 34 (20).
Work same as for Bib through Row 14.
For Tall Bottle Cozy
Row 15 (Right Side): Ch 1, turn, sc in first st, skip next st, sc in next st, *3 sc in next st, sc in each of next 2 sts, skip 2 sts, sc in next 2 sts; repeat from * 2 more times, holding Ring on top of fabric, continue in pattern working next 3 sts through hole of Ring and into sts of Cozy, work as established to end of row. 
For Short Bottle Cozy
Row 15 (Right Side): Ch 1, turn, sc in first st, skip next st, sc in next st, 3 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts, skip 2 sts, sc in next 2 sts, holding Ring on top of fabric, continue in pattern working next 3 sts through hole of Ring and into sts of Cozy, work as established to end of row. 
For Both Sizes
Row 16: Repeat Row 2.
Row 17: Repeat Row 15.
Rows 18-24 (36): Repeat Row 2. 
Fasten off, leaving a long tail.
FINISHING
Fold Cozy in half, matching sts from Row 1 with Row 24 (36), and whipstitch edges together. 
Base
With A, ch 4, slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, work 6 sc in ring – 6 sc.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around – 12 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times – 18 sc.
Round 4: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times – 24 sc. 
For Short Bottle Cozy Only
Round 5: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times – 30 sc.
Round 6: [Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times – 36 sc. 
For Both Sizes
Joining Base
With wrong sides together and A, fit one edge of Body piece around edge of Base and working through both thicknesses, sc in each st around to join pieces together. 
Strap
Round 1: Join A with sc in opposite edge of Body and sc 24 (36) sts evenly spaced around.
For Tall Bottle Cozy Only
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in each st around, slip st in each first st to join – 24 sc.

pattern_name: Gnome for the Holidays Wine Bottle Cozy
materials: Bernat® Handicrafter® Holidays (80 g/2.8 oz; 126 m/138 yds)
Bernat Handicrafter® Cotton (50 g/1.75 oz; 73 m/80 yds)
Size 5 mm (U.S. H/8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Loop = Insert hook into stitch. Wrap yarn around finger and pull up a loop. Keeping finger in place, yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook.
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: To fit 0.75L wine bottle.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: When joining new color, work to last 2 loops on hook of first color. Draw new color through last 2 loops and proceed.
With MC, ch 15, then with B, ch 18. 
1st row: (RS). With B, 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 16 ch. With MC, 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 32 sc.
2nd row: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Loop in each of next 14 sts. (Loops will appear on RS). With B, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 17 sc. With MC, 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows until work from beg measures 6" [15 cm], ending on a 2nd row.
Make ‘Face’: Next row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 17 sc. With MC, 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. Do not break MC. Join C. With C, 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. Do not break C. With MC, 1 sc in each of last 5 sts. Turn.
Next row: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Loop in each of next 3 sc. With C, 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. With MC, Loop in each of next 4 sc. With B, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Next row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 17 sc. With MC, 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. With C, 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 4 times in next st. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – Bobble made (nose). 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. With MC, 1 sc in each of last 4 sc. Turn.
Next row: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Loop in each of next 2 sc. With C, 1 sc in each of next 9 sts. With MC, Loop in each of next 3 sc. With B, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Next row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 17 sc. With MC, 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. With C, 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. With MC, 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Turn.
Next row: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Loop in each of next 4 sc. With C, 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Break C. With MC, Loop in each of next 5 sc. With B, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Next row: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 17 sc. With MC, 1 sc in each of next 15 sc. Fasten off.
Sew side seams tog.
HAT
With A, ch 40. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring, taking care to not twist ch.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc. 40 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sts.
Join Hat to Gnome: 1st rnd: Align Hat over Gnome Body, having Hat on outside. With A, ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sts.
4th and 5th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 16 sts.
7th and 8th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
9th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sts.
10th to 13th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Fasten off at end of 13th rnd.
FINISHING
Sew black beads to Face for eyes as shown in picture. With red embroidery floss, embroider mouth using outline st.

materials: Patons Canadiana (100 g/3.5 oz; 187 m/205 yds) Main Color (MC) 10413 (Raspberry) 1 ball
Sizes 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) and 6 mm (U.S. J or 10) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain tension
abbreviations: Dcbp = yo and insert hook from back to front around post of dc 1 row below. yo and draw up a loop. yo and draw through 2 loops on hook. yo and draw through all loops on hook.
Dcfp = yo and insert hook from front to back around post of dc 1 row below. yo and draw up a loop. yo and draw through 2 loops on hook. yo and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: To fit 4 cup teapot.
gauge: 17 sc and 18 rows = 4" [10 cm] with smaller hook.
instructions:
Cupcake Liner (make 2 alike).
Note: Ch 3 at beg of row counts as dc throughout.
With smaller hook and MC, ch 36. 
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each ch across. Turn. 34 dc.
2nd row: Ch 3. (1 dcfp around next st. 1 dcbp around next st) 16 times. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.
Rep 2nd row 10 times more. 
Fasten off.
Cupcake Top
With smaller hook and A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc) 6 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) 5 times. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) 6 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc) 5 times. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 36 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc) 6 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 42 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc) 5 times. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 48 sc.
9th rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc) 6 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 54 sc.
10th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc) 5 times. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 60 sc. 
11th rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc) 6 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 66 sc.
12th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc) 5 times. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 72 sc.
13th rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc) 6 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 78 sc.
14th to 16th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Fasten off.
Icing
With larger hook and holding 2 strands of B tog, ch 71.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch across. Turn. 70 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc.
Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook – sc2tog made. (1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog) 3 times. (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog) 3 times.  (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog) 3 times. (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog) 3 times. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew Icing into spiral shape as pictured. Sew Icing to Cupcake Top. 
With WS of Cupcake Liner pieces tog, sew side edges tog at top 
corner and along last row only, leaving openings for spout and 
handle. Sew Cupcake Top to Liner as pictured. Sew beads in random 
pattern to Icing as shown in photo.
Pom-pom (make 1).
Wind C around 2 fingers approx 30 times. Remove from fingers and 
tie tightly in center. Cut through each side of loops. Trim to a smooth 
round shape. Attach to top of Icing spiral.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver: 1 skein 316 Soft White A
small amounts of 319 Cherry Red B
clean dry soda can to hold shape while stuffing ball
abbreviations: A, B, C, D = Color A, Color B, Color C, Color D
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Cozy measures 9.5” (24 cm) wide by 4” (10 cm) tall and fits 12 oz. soda can.
gauge: With double strand yarn, 12 hdc = 4” [10 cm]; 11 rows hdc = 4” [10 cm]. With single strand yarn, 14 sc = 4” [10 cm]; 20 rows sc = 4” [10 cm]. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Rounds 6-13: Sc in each sc around.
Round 14: [Sc2tog, sc in each of the next  3 sc] 12 times — 48 sc.
Round 15: Sc in each sc around.
Round 16: [Sc2tog, sc in each of the next  2 sc] 12 times — 36 sc.
Round 17: Sc in each sc around.
Begin stuffing to create round ball shape. Stuff firmly to define shape but do not overstuff or stretch stitches (this helps prevent stuffing from showing through work). It may be helpful to place a soda can inside the Lining to hold its shape while working. Continue stuffing as you close.
Round 18: [Sc2tog, sc in the next sc] 12 times — 24 sc.
Round 19: Join Ball to Lining by single crocheting Ball Round 18 and open loops of Lining Round 5 together. Match and sc together each st and loop around, stuffing and shaping. Fasten off, weave ends in.

Mitt
With C, ch 2.
Row 1: 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook; turn — 5 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each of the next 5 sc; turn — 5 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each of the next 4 sc, 2 sc in last sc; turn—6 sc.
Row 4: [Ch 4, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each of the next 2 chs, slip st in next st to make finger] 4 times. Ch 3, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next ch, slip st in last 2 sts, slip st across ends of rows ending in beginning ch. Fasten off, leaving 10” (25 cm) tail.

Cozy measures 9.5” (24 cm) wide by 4” (10 cm) tall and fits 12 oz. soda can.

Special Stitches
sc2tog = [draw up a loop in next st] twice, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.

COZY
Lining
Lining is worked holding two strands of yarn throughout. Work loosely so that inside cup has a little stretch. With A, ch 2.
Round 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with slip st in first st — 6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, [2 sc in next sc] 6 times; join — 12 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, [2 hdc in next sc, hdc in next sc] 6 times; join — 18 hdc.
Round 4: Ch 1, [Hdc in each of the next 2 hdc, 2 hdc in the next hdc] 6 times; join — 24 hdc.
Round 5: Ch 1, hdc in back loop only of each hdc around; join — 24 hdc.
Rounds 6-12: Ch 1, hdc in each hdc around; join — 24 hdc. Fasten off, weave ends in.

Ball
Ball is worked in continuous rounds without joining or turning. Use a stitch holder to mark the beginning of each Round, moving up as work progresses. Using one strand of A, hold Liner with the top facing and join yarn in any back loop of Lining Round 12.
Round 1: [Sc in back loop of next st, 2 sc in back loop of next st] 12 times — 36 sc.
Round 2: Sc in each sc around.
Round 3: [2 sc in next sc, sc in each of the next 2 sc] 12 times — 48 sc.
Round 4: Sc in each sc around.
Round 5: [Sc in each of the next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 12 times — 60 sc.

Finishing
Use photo as a guide for finishing. Using scrap yarn in yarn needle and a loose running stitch, outline an oval on each side of the Ball. Using B, fill in the circle outline with small V-stitches. Remove scrap yarn. Satin stitch eyes one-third of the way down the face, about 3 or 4 stitches apart. Add a V-smile and eyebrows. Position Mitt on the left side of the face, stuff very lightly to give dimension, and sew on. With a short strand of D, run a yarn tail back and forth between the 4 fingers of the glove to suggest webbing. Fasten off and weave in ends.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (Solids: 70.9 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds) 00010 (Yellow) 1 ball
Size 5 mm (U.S. H/8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approximately 8 inches [20.5 centimeters] square.
gauge: 13 single crochets and 14 rows = 4 inches [10 centimeters].
instructions:
Chain 26. 
1st row: 1 single crochet in 2nd chain from hook. 1 single crochet in each chain to end of chain. Turn. (You should have 25 single crochets at end of row.)
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 single crochet in each single crochet across row. Turn. (You should have 25 single crochets at end of row.)
Repeat last row until work from beginning measures 8 inches [20.5 centimeters].
Button loop: Chain 6. Join with slip stitch to last single crochet. Fasten off.
Weave in ends.
FINISHING
Sew button to center of cloth.
Fasten off by cutting working yarn approx 6 inches [15 centimeters] long and draw this end through last loop. Pull tightly to secure.
Thread yarn through a blunt tip large eye needle and make small alternating stitches along the wrong side edge of your work. After you have worked about 2 inches [5 centimeters] in one direction, turn and work backwards alternating over the spaces you just worked. Now you can safely cut the end.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® Super Craft Kit - 1 Kit
Contrast A Lavender 1 ball or 10 yds/9.5 m
Contrast B Spring Green 1 ball or 8 yds/7.5 m
Contrast C Black 1 ball or 5 yds/4.5m
Contrast A Shocking Pink 1 ball or 10 yds/9.5 m
Contrast B Carrot 1 ball or 8 yds/7.5 m
Contrast C Soft White 1 ball or 5 yds/4.5m
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
2 buttons – 5/8" [1.5 cm] for each Mug Hug.
measurements: One size to fit average coffee mug – approx 10" [25.5 cm] circumference.
gauge: 12 dc and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Motif 1: Make 2 with A as Color 1 and B as Color 2.
Motif 2: Make 1 with B as Color 1 and A as Color 2.
With Color 1, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring. See diagram on page 2.
1st rnd: Ch 3. 2 dc in ring. (Ch 2. 3 dc) 3 times in ring. Ch 2. Join with sl st to top of beg ch-3. Fasten off.
2nd rnd: Join Color 2 with sl st to any ch-2 sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in same sp as sl st. [Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp] 3 times. Ch 1. Join with sl st to top of beg ch-3. Fasten off.
Edging and Buttonholes:
Join C with sl st to top right corner of long edge.
1st rnd: Ch 1. Work sc evenly to next corner. Work 5 sc in corner. Ch 6 for buttonhole. Work sc evenly in sc to next corner. Ch 6 for buttonhole. 5 sc in corner. Cont working evenly in sc, having 5 sc in each corner. Join.
Fasten off.
Buttons (make 2).
Ch 2. Leave a long end for sewing.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd:  Working in front loops only, 1 sl st in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sl st.
Fasten off.
Sew Buttons to Mug Hug as shown in photo.

pattern_name: DON'T FORGETTY YOUR YETI CROCHET BOTTLE COZY
materials: Bernat® Maker™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 317 yds/290 m)
Contrast A Cream (06003) 1 ball or 160 yds/146 m
Contrast B Sky Blue (06009) 1 ball or 80 yds/73 m
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume™ crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: Approx 7" tall [18 cm], excluding Legs to fit standard water bottle, or adjust as desired.
gauge: 14 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Do not join at ends of rnds unless otherwise stated. Cont working in spiral placing marker on first st of rnd for easier counting.
BODY
See diagram on page 3.
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. PM. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 18 sc.
4th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 24 sc.
5th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 30 sc.
6th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 36 sc.
7th rnd: Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around.
8th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
Rep 8th rnd until work from ridge of 7th rnd measures approx 6¼" [16 cm], or until Body reaches 1" [2.5 cm] below top of water bottle.
Shape mouth opening and head:
1st rnd: 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Ch 8. Skip next 18 sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc.
2nd rnd: 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. 1 sc in each of next 18 ch. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc.
3rd and 4th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
5th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 30 sc.
6th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
7th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 24 sc.
8th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
9th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 18 sc.
10th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
11th rnd: *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 12 sc.
12th rnd: (Sc2tog) 6 times. 6 sc.
Fasten off. Draw yarn through rem sts.
FACE
See diagram on page 4.
With B, ch 38. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring, making sure not to twist ch.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 3 sc in first ch. 1 sc in each of next 18 ch. 3 sc in next ch. 1 sc in each of next 18 ch. PM. 42 sc.
2nd row: 2 sc in each of first 3 sc. 1 sc in each of next 18 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sl st in next sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
3rd row: Skip first sl st. Sl st in each of next 6 sc. 1 sc in next sc. 1 hdc in each of nxt 16 sc. 1 sc in next sc. Sl st in each of next 7 sc. Fasten off.
Sew 1st rnd of Face around Body to match mouth opening (see photo). Mark placement for safety eyes on Face and following manufacturer’s instructions, attach safety eyes to Face.
Sew outside of Face to Body. Using length of A, embroider eyebrows above eyes as shown in photo.
Horns (make 2)
See diagram on page 4.
With B, ch 2.
1st rnd: 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook. PM. 3 sc.
2nd rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
3rd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 6 sc.
4th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
Fasten off, leaving tail for sewing.
Sew Horns to head of Body as shown in photo.
Teeth (make 2)
See diagram on page 4.
With A, ch 3.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in last ch. Turn. 2 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row.
Fasten off, leaving tail for sewing.
Sew Teeth to bottom of Mouth as shown in photo.
Legs (make 2)
See diagram on page 4.
With B, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. PM. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 18 sc.
4th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 24 sc.
5th rnd: 1 sc in each of first 7 sc. *1 sc in next sc (Ch 2. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook) toe made. 1 sc in next sc of rnd. Rep from * 4 times more. 1 sc in each of last 7 sc.
6th rnd: 1 sc in each of first 7 sc. *1 sc in next sc. Skip Toe. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * 4 times more. 1 sc in each of last 7 sc.
7th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Break B. Join A.
8th to 12th rnds: With A, 1 sc in each sc around.
13th rnd: *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 12 sc.
14th and 15th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
Fasten off, leaving tail for sewing.
Sew Legs to rem front loops from 7th rnd of Body on each side as shown in photo.
Straps (make 2)
See diagram on page 4.
With A, ch 52.
1st row: 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each ch to end of ch. 50 dc. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 950 Mexicana A, 672 Spring Green B.
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 5mm [US H-8], 6mm [US J-10]
abbreviations: A, B, = Color A, Color B
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Cozy measures 3” (7.5 cm) diameter and 4” (10 cm) high
gauge: 14 sts = 4” [10 cm]; 15 rows = 4” [10 cm]. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SHAMROCK
With B and 6mm [J-10] hook, ch 2.
Round 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook, join with slip st in top of first sc – 6 sc.
