Round 2: Cluster st, slip st in next 2 sc, cluster st in same st as last slip st made, slip st in next 2 sts, cluster st in same st as last slip st made, slip st in last sc, ch 6, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and next 4 chs, join with slip st to sc at base of ch-6. Fasten off, leaving long end for sewing.
FINISHING
Referring to photo for placement, sew Shamrock onto front of Cozy. Weave in ends.
Special Stitches
Cluster st = Ch 3, *yarn over, insert hook in same st and pull up a loop, yarn over and draw through 2 loops on hook; repeat from * 2 more times; yarn over and draw through all 4 loops on hook, ch 3, slip st in same st at base of cluster.
Special Technique
In order to get the rainbow effect, select a section of solid color on the skein and start in the middle of it.
COZY
With A and 5mm [H-8] hook, start in the middle of any solid color, ch 2.
Round 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook, join with slip st in top of first sc – 6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc around, join with slip st in top of first sc – 12 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, [sc in sc, 2 sc in next sc], repeat around, join with slip st in top of first sc – 18 sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, [sc in 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc], repeat around, join with slip st in top of first sc – 24 sc.
Round 5: Ch 1, [sc in 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc], repeat around, join with slip st in top of first sc – 30 sc.
Round 6: Ch 1, sc in back loop of each sc around, join with slip st in top of first sc – 30 sc.
Round 7: Ch 1, sc in both loops of each sc around, join with slip st in top of first sc – 30 sc.
Rounds 8-19: Repeat Round 7. Fasten off.

materials: 1 skein each 312 Black A and 3620 Glowworm B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 5.5mm [US I-9] and 6.5mm [US K-10½]
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Cozy fits 12-ounce bottle.
gauge: Rounds 1–4 = 2½" (6.5 cm) with smaller hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
COZY
With smaller hook and A, make an adjustable ring, ch 1.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc—12 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in first st, 2 sc in next st, *sc in next st, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—18 sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sts, 2 sc in next st, *sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—24 sc.
Round 5: Ch 1, sc in first st, *ch 7, skip next 3 sts, sc in next st; repeat from * 4 times, ch 3, dc in first sc (ch 3 and dc count as last ch-7 space here and throughout)—6 ch-7 spaces.
Round 6: Ch 1, sc around post of dc of last ch-7 space, *ch 7, sc in 4th ch of next ch-7 space; repeat from * 4 times, ch 3, dc in first sc—6 ch-7 spaces.
Rounds 7–10: Repeat Round 6.
Round 11: Ch 1, 3 sc around post of dc of last ch-7 space, 3 sc in 4th ch of each remaining ch-7 space; join with slip st in first sc—18 sc.
Round 12: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.

SPIDER
Motif Top Half
With smaller hook and A, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with slip st in first sc—8 sc.
Round 2: Ch 2, slip st in 2nd ch from hook, **slip st in next st, [ch 6, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and in remaining 4 ch] twice**, *slip st in next st, [ch 8, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and in remaining 6 ch] twice*, sc in next 2 sts; repeat from * to *; repeat from ** to **, slip st in next st, ch 2, slip st in 2nd ch from hook; join with slip st in bottom of beginning ch—2 pairs of short legs and 2 pairs of long legs. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing motif to base.

Motif Bottom Half
With smaller hook and A, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc—12 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sts; leave remaining sts unworked—2 sc. Fasten off, leaving long tail for sewing to top half.
With tail, sew each sc of Round 3 to each sc between pairs of long legs of top half.

Base
With larger hook and B, repeat top and bottom halves of motif.

ASSEMBLY & FINISHING
Center motif on its base and with long tail of motif top half, sew together. Slip cozy on bottle. Place motif on cozy and with long tail of base, sew in place. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 Skein MC will make several covers; small amounts CC for lettering and/or trim.
measurements: Cover fits 8” circumference bottle.
gauge: 14 sts = 4”; 16 rows = 4” in sc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
FRONT: With MC, ch 16.
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn – 15 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Repeat Row 2 until 3” from beginning, end by working a wrong side row.
Divide for Neck Opening-First Side: Ch 1, sc in first 7 sc; turn. Work 1 row even on these 7 sc.
Next Row: Ch 1, sc in 5 sc; draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc, draw through all 3 loops on hook – sc2tog made; turn – 6 sc. Work 1 row even.
Next Row: Ch 1, sc in 4 sc, sc2tog; turn – 5 sc. Work 1 row even.
Next Row: Ch 1, sc in 3 sc, sc2tog; turn – 4 sc. Work 1 row even. Fasten off.
Second Side: With right side facing, attach yarn in next sc of last long row; ch 1, sc in same sc and in each sc across; turn – 7 sc. Work 1 row even.
Next Row: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each sc across; turn – 6 sc. Work 1 row even.
Next Row: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each sc across; turn – 5 sc. Work 1 row even.
Next Row: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each sc across; turn – 4 sc.
Next Row: Ch 1, sc in 4 sc, ch 7, sc in 4 sc of first side; turn.
Next Row: Ch 1, sc in 4 sc, sc in 7 ch, sc in 4 sc; turn – 15 sc.
BACK: Work even across 15 sc until back measures 5” from back neck edge or until back measures same as front to “shoulders”. Fasten off.
SLEEVES: With right side facing, attach yarn at side in the first row end of the neck division; ch 1, work 12 sc evenly across the same row end and the next 15 rows; turn – 12 sc. Work even in sc for 1 1/2”. Fasten off. Repeat on opposite side over same row ends for second sleeve.
ADD TEAM NUMBER: With right facing and CC, work chain stitch number(s) following appropriate chart onto front of jersey with embroidery chain stitch or using crochet hook (hold hook above fabric and yarn below fabric).
FINISHING: Sew side and sleeve seams. Tack the sleeve to the side seam as shown.
Lower Edging: With right side facing, attach MC or CC at a side seam; ch 3, dc evenly around; join with a sl st to top of ch-3. Fasten off.
Neck Edging: With right side facing, attach MC or CC at back neck; ch 1, sc evenly around neck opening; join with a sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each of 316 Soft White A, 254 Pumpkin B, 312 Black C, and 885 Delft Blue D.
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C etc.
measurements: Hug fits 4” high mug with 3” top diameter and bottom diameter.
gauge: 8 sts = 2”; 8 rows = 2”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain gauge.
instructions:
MUG HUG
Wrap
With A, ch 14.
Row 1: Sc in second ch from hook and each remaining ch across, ch 1; turn – 13 sc.
Rows 2 – 34: Working in back loops only, sc in each sc across, ch 1; turn. At end of Row 34, ch 10, slip st to last sc of Row 34 (button loop made). Fasten off.
Nose
With B and E hook, ch 5, slip st in second ch from hook, sc next ch, hdc in next ch, dc in last ch. Fasten off.
Scarf
With D, ch 38.
Row 1: Hdc in second ch from hook and each remaining ch across, ch 1; turn – 37 hdc.
Row 2: Hdc in each hdc across. Fasten off.
Tie
With D, ch 11. Row 1: Hdc in second ch from hook and each remaining ch across, ch 1; turn – 10 hdc.
Row 2: Hdc in each hdc across. Fasten off.
ASSEMBLY
Using photo as a guide, sew nose in place with B. With C, embroider French knots for mouth and satin st eyes. With D, sew scarf around bottom of wrap about ½” up. Gather middle and tie together and sew to scarf. Sew button in place on back of wrap. Weave in ends.
Cozy up with a hot cocoa or other warm beverage! This mood lifting crocheted mug cozy is a great gift idea and made with easy-care yarn, it can be washed and look great for a long time.
RED HEART® Super Saver®: Art. E300 available in solid color 7 oz (198 g), 364 yd (333 m); multi color, fleck and print 5 oz (141 g), 244 yd (223 m) skeins.

materials: RED HEART® Soft®: 1 ball each 4601 Off White A and 4614 Black B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 6.0mm [US J-10], 3.5mm [US E-4], 2.75mm [US C-2]
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Cozy fits doorknobs 6¼” (16 cm) around.
gauge: With 6.0mm [J-10] hook, 16 sc = 4” [10 cm]; 20 rows = 4”
instructions:
Eye (Make 2)
With 2.75mm [C-2] hook and B, ch 4.
Row 1: 2 sc in second ch from hook, slip st in next ch, 3 sc in last ch—6 sts.
Row 2: Turn and work into the opposite side of the foundation chain. 3 sc in first ch, slip st in next ch, 3 sc in last ch; slip st in top of first sc in Row 1 to join—7 sts. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Ear (Make 2)
With 3.5mm [E-4] hook and B, ch 2.
Round 1: 4 sc in 2nd ch from hook; ch 1, turn—4 sc.
Round 2: [2 sc in next sc] 4 times; ch 1, turn—8 sc.
Round 3: 7 sc, 2 sc in next sc—9 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Finishing
Referring to photograph for placement, sew Nose to snout in center of Cozy. Embroider a mouth on snout below the Nose. Sew Eyes above snout. Sew Ears above Eyes. Weave in all ends.
Special Stitches
sc2tog = [draw up a loop in next st] twice, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
Note
Unless otherwise noted, Rounds are worked without joining or turning. It may be helpful to use stitch markers to mark ends of Rounds.
COZY
Head
With 6.0mm [J-10] hook and A, ch 2.
Round 1: 6 sc in second ch from hook—6 sc.
Round 2: 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Round 3: 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc, 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc, 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc—15 sc.
Round 4: 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc, 6 sc, 2 sc in next sc, 4 sc—17 sc.
Round 5: Sc in each sc around—17 sc.
Round 6: Working in front loops only, 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc, [3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 3 times, 2 sc—21 sc.
Round 7: Working in both loops, [6 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 3 times—24 sc.
Round 8: 11 sc, 2 sc in next sc, 12 sc—25 sc.
Round 9: Sc in each sc around—25 sc.
Round 10: 12 sc, sc2tog, 11 sc; ch 1, turn—24 sc.
Round 11: [6 sc, sc2tog] 3 times; ch 1, turn—21 sc.
Round 12: [3 sc, sc2tog] 4 times, sc; ch 1, turn—17 sc.
Round 13: [Sc, sc2tog] 5 times, 2 sc—12 sc. Fasten off, weave in ends.
Nose
With 2.75mm [C-2] hook and B, ch 3.
Row 1: Work (dc, hdc, sc, dc, sc, hdc, dc) all in 3rd ch from hook, ch 2, slip st into same st as last dc—8 sts. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 944 Cherrycola A, 321 Gold B, and 316 Soft White C.
Yarn needle; two 12mm buttons for eyes; one ¾” wooden button.
abbreviations: A, B, C = color A, B, C
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Size: 3¾” tall.
gauge: 10 sts = 3”; 8 rows = 3½” in pattern. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
WRAp
With A ch 14.
Row 1 (Wrong Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across; turn – 13 sc.
Row 2 (Right Side): Ch 3, skip first st, dc in next st and each st across; turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, slip st in first dc, * dc in next dc, slip st in next dc; repeat from * across working last slip st in top of ch-3; turn.
Rows 4-23: Repeat Rows 2 and 3.
Row 24: Ch 3, skip first st, dc in next st and each st across, ch 10, slip st in last dc for button loop. Fasten off.
Beak
With B ch 6; dc in 3rd ch from hook, hdc in next ch, sc in next ch, slip st in last ch. Fasten off.
Eye (Make 2)
With C ch 4; 11 dc in 3rd ch from hook; join with a slip st to top of ch-3. Fasten off. Sew button to center of eye.
FiNiSHiNG
Sew Beak and Eyes in place. Sew button to beginning edge to correspond to button loop. Sew first 3 sts of Row 24 to corresponding 3 sts of beginning ch. Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Softee® Chunky™ (100 g/3.5 oz; 99 m/108 yds)
Size 8 mm (U.S. L/11) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 10" [25.5 cm] around x 4" [10 cm] high. Note: Cozy is sized to fit a larger mug, measuring approx 11" [28 cm] around.
gauge: 8 sc and 9 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
Ch 23.
1st row: (RS). 2 sc in 4th ch from hook (count as 1 dc and 2 sc). Ch 2. 2 sc in next ch. *Miss next 2 ch. 2 sc in next ch. Ch 2. 2 sc in next ch. Rep from * to last 2 ch. Miss next ch. 1 sc in last ch. Turn. 21 sc.
2nd to 5th rows: Ch 3 (count as dc). (2 sc. Ch 2. 2 sc) in each ch-2 sp, ending with 1 sc in 3rd ch of ch 3. Turn.
Do not fasten off.
Edging: Work sc evenly down side edge, 2 sc in first corner, sc evenly along foundation ch and 2 sc at 2nd corner. Work along rem side edge as follows: *Ch 3. Miss next 2 rows. Work 1 sc up side edge. Rep from * once more. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew buttons onto opposite edge to correspond with button loops.

materials: RED HEART® “Eco-Ways Bamboo Wool™”: 2 Balls, 3920 Cayenne
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
[ ] = work instructions in brackets as directed
measurements: Bottle Cover measures 3” across and 12 1/2” high.
gauge: GAUGE: Rnds 1-5 = 3 1/2” across. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Ch 4; join with a slip in 4th ch from hook to form a ring.
Rnd 1: Ch 1, 8 sc in ring; DO NOT JOIN but work in continuous rnds. Mark end of rnd. Move marker up each rnd.
Work in back loops only beginning with Rnd 2.
Rnd 2: [2 Sc in next sc] 8 times – 16 sc.
Rnd 3: [2 Sc in next sc, sc in next sc] 8 times – 24 sc.
Rnd 4: [2 Sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc] 8 times – 32 sc.
Rnd 5: [2 Sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc] 8 times – 40 sc.
Rnd 6: [2 Sc in next sc, sc in next 4 sc] 8 times – 48 sc.
Rnds 7-48: Sc in each sc around. At end of Rnd 48, join with a slip st in both loops of next sc.
Now work remaining rnds in both loops.
Rnd 49: Ch 4, skip next sc, * dc in next sc, ch 1, skip next sc; repeat from * around; join with a slip st in 3rd ch of ch-4.
Rnd 50: Slip st in ch-1 space, ch 1, sc in same space, 5 dc in next space, * sc in next ch-1 space, 5 dc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * around; join with a slip st in first sc. 
Fasten off. Weave in ends.
TIE
Ch 101, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across. 
Fasten off. Weave in ends. Weave through ch-1 spaces of Rnd 49. Tie knots in each end of tie.

materials: RED HEART® Team Spirit™: 1 ball 940 Red/Blue
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6 mm [US J-10]
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Cozy fits a sports cooler 18” (46 cm) in circumference and 10½” (26.5 cm) in height.
instructions:
COZY
Ch 3; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, 8 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc – 16 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in first sc, 2 sc in next sc, [sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 7 times; join with slip st in first sc – 24 sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in each of first 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc, [sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 7 times; join with slip st in first sc – 32 sc.
Round 5: Ch 1, sc in each of first 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc, [sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 7 times; join with slip st in first sc – 40 sc.
Round 6: Ch 1, sc in each of first 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc, [sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 7 times; join with slip st in first sc – 48 sc.
Round 7: Ch 1, sc in each of first 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc, [sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 7 times; join with slip st in first sc – 56 sc.
Round 8: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc – 56 sc.
Round 9: Ch 1, bpsc in each sc around; join with slip st in first bpsc.
Round 10 (Right Side): Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc.
Note: Starting with the next round, turn work at beginning of each round, alternately facing Right Side and Wrong Side.
Next round (Wrong Side): Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc.
Rep the last round until Cozy measures 10” (25.5 cm) in height, ending after a Wrong Side round.
Next round (Right Side): Ch 1, turn, * slip st in each of next 23 sts of round, ch 24, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and in each of next 22 ch (unattached button loop made); rep from * once more; join with slip st in first slip st.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew the end of each button loop to its base on inside of Cozy. Sew a button securely with sewing needle and thread to base of each button loop.

materials: RED HEART® “Spark-a-Doodle™”: 1 ball each 9901 Reddy A and 9368 Shamrock B.
Small amount of scrap yarn to match A; yarn needle; 1 yd ribbon.
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
measurements: Bottle Cover is 14” tall and 13” around.
gauge: 15 sc = 6½”; 16 rows = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
NOTE
When working with Spark-a-Doodle™, work 1 sc with yarn between pompoms, keeping pompoms at back of work and being careful not to pull pompoms through sts.
BOTTLE COVER
With scrap yarn, ch 30. Fasten off.
Row 1 (Right Side): Join A in 1st ch, ch 1, sc in same st, sc in each ch across; turn – 30 sts.
Row 2: Ch 2, sc in each st across; turn.
Repeat Row 2 until Bottle Cover is 7” from beginning. Fasten off.
Next Row: Join B in 1st st, ch 2, sc in each st across; turn.
Repeat Row 2 until Bottle Cover is 13½”, ending with a Right Side row. Fasten off.
Next Row (Wrong Side): Join A in 1st st, ch 2, sc in each st across; turn.
Next Row: Ch 2, sc in each st across. Fasten off.
FiNiSHiNG
Fold Bottle Cover in half. With scrap yarn, sew ends and bottom together to form tube.
Weave ribbon through sts at neck of Bottle Cover and tie into a bow.

materials: Patons® Classic Wool (100 g/3.5 oz; 192 m/210 yds)
Size 5.5 mm (U.S. I or 9) crochet hook or size needed to obtain tension
measurements: Approx 9" x 7" [23 x 18 cm] after felting, to fit 4-6 cup teapot.
gauge: 13 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Front and Back (make 2 pieces alike)
With MC, ch 41.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 
40 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 8" [20.5 cm].
Fasten off.
Flower 1 (Make 2 with D as Color 1 and C as Color 2. Make 2 with C as 
Color 1 and B as Color 2).
With Color 1, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
2nd rnd: Join Color 2 with sl st to any sc. *Ch 3. (Yoh and draw up a 
loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice in next st. Yoh and draw 
through all loops on hook – cluster made. Ch 3. Sl st in same sp as cluster. 
Rep from * around. Fasten off.
Flower 2 
(Make 2 with E as Color 1, C as Color 2 and A as Color 3. Make 2 with F as 
Color 1, B as Color 2 and D as Color 3).
With Color 1, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
2nd rnd: Join Color 2 with sl st to any sc. Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. 
12 sc. Fasten off.
3rd rnd: Join Color 3 with sl st to any sc. *Ch 5. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 
1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 2 ch. Miss next sc. Sl st in next sc. 
Ch 6. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. 
Miss next sc. Sl st in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to same 
sp as first sl st.
4th rnd: Sl st in each st of outer edge of Petals around. Fasten off.
Flower 3 (Make 2 with B as Color 1 and E as Color 2. Make 2 with A as 
Color 1 and F as Color 2).
With Color 1, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten 
off. 12 sc. 
3rd rnd: Join Color 2 with sl st to any sc. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 3. 1 sc) in each sc 
around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Finishing 
Felt Front, Back, and Flowers according to “How to Felt" instructions (see 
page 3). Cut out Front and Back pieces using template. With F, sew Back 
and Front tog with blanket st, leaving openings for spout and handle. 
With F, finish spout and handle openings with blanket st. Sew 6 Flowers 
to each side of Tea Cozy.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 376 Burgundy A, 319 Cherry Red B, and 3950 Charcoal C
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Cozy measures 9½” (24 cm) circumference at bottom x 8” (20.5 cm) tall.
gauge: 5 sts = 2” (5 cm); 13 rows = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
COZY
With A, ch 25.
Round 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; join with slip st in first sc—24 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc. 
Rounds 3 and 4: Ch 1, sc in first 3 sts; change to B, sc in next 3 sts; change to A, *sc in next 3 sts; change to B, sc in next 3 sts; change to A; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 5: Ch 1, sc in first 3 sts; change to B, sc in next 3 sts; change to A, [sc in next 3 sts; change to B, sc in next 3 sts; change to A] twice; sc in next 3 sts; change to B, sc in next 3 sts; change to C; join with slip st in first sc.
Rounds 6 and 7: Ch 1, sc in first 3 sts; change to A, sc in next 3 sts; change to C, *sc in next 3 sts; change to A, sc in next 3 sts; change to C; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 8: Ch 1, sc in first 3 sts; change to A, sc in next 3 sts; change to C, [sc in next 3 sts; change to A, sc in next 3 sts; change to C] twice, sc in next 3 sts; change to A, sc in next 3 sts; join with slip st in first sc.
Rounds 9–11: Repeat Round 3. 
Rounds 12–14: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 15: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sts, sc2tog, *sc in next 2 sts, sc2tog; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—18 sc.
Round 16: Ch 1, sc in first st, sc2tog, *sc in next st, sc2tog; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—12 sc.
Round 17: Ch 1, sc in first st, sc2tog, [sc in next 2 sts, sc2tog] twice; join with slip st in first sc—8 sc. 
Note Continue in continuous (spiral) rounds, do not join at end of round until instructed. Place marker for beginning of round and move marker up as each round is completed.
Rounds 18–22: Ch 1, sc in each st around.
Round 23: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Phentex® Slipper & Craft Yarn (3 oz/85 g; 164 yds/150 m)
Hot Lime (07712) or Hot Orange (07628) or Matador (00570) or Grape (07332) or Aqua (07201) 1 ball
Size U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
measurements: To fit plant pot 6¾" [17 cm] in diameter x 5½" [14 cm] tall or circular plant pot of chosen size.
gauge: 15 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 8 sc in ring. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 40 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 48 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 56 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 64 sc.
9th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 72 sc.
Note: To customize size, cont to inc 8 sts each rnd as established until desired diameter for bottom.
Next rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Place marker at end of rnd.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd until work from marked rnd measures 5½" [14 cm] or desired height. Fasten off.

materials: 1 skein each 312 Black A and 722 Pretty ‘n Pink B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 5.5mm [US I-9] and 6.5mm [US K-10½]
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Cozy fits 12-ounce bottle.
gauge: Rounds 1–4 = 2½" (6.5 cm) with smaller hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
COZY
With smaller hook and A, make an adjustable ring, ch 1.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc—12 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in first st, 2 sc in next st, *sc in next st, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—18 sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sts, 2 sc in next st, *sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—24 sc.
Round 5: Ch 1, sc in first st, *ch 7, skip next 3 sts, sc in next st; repeat from * 4 times, ch 3, dc in first sc (ch 3 and dc count as last ch-7 space here and throughout)—6 ch-7 spaces.
Round 6: Ch 1, sc around post of dc of last ch-7 space, *ch 7, sc in 4th ch of next ch-7 space; repeat from * 4 times, ch 3, dc in first sc—6 ch-7 spaces.
Rounds 7–10: Repeat Round 6.
Round 11: Ch 1, 3 sc around post of dc of last ch-7 space, 3 sc in 4th ch of each remaining ch-7 space; join with slip st in first sc—18 sc.
Round 12: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
HAT Motif
With smaller hook and A, ch 2.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, turn—1 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in sc, turn—2 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Row 4: Repeat Row 3.
Row 5: Ch 1, 2 sc in each st across, turn—4 sc.
Rows 6 and 7: Repeat Row 3.
Row 8: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in last st, turn—6 sc.
Row 9: Repeat Row 3.
Row 10: Ch 2 (counts as dc here and throughout this row), 4 dc in first st, sc in next 4 sts, (4 dc, ch 2, slip st) in last st—14 dc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Base
With larger hook and B, repeat Rows 1–10 of hat.
ASSEMBLY & FINISHING
Center motif on its base and with long tail of motif, sew together.
Slip cozy on bottle. Place motif on cozy and, with long tail of base, sew in place. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Soft®: 1 ball each 9935 Waterscape A, 4422 Tangerine B, and 4600 White C
abbreviations: A, B, C = color A, B, C
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Cozy Measures 3¾” (9.5 cm) tall
gauge: 12 sts = 3” (7.6 cm); 11 rows = 3½” (8.9 cm) in pattern. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Wrap
With A ch 16.
Row 1 (Wrong Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across; turn – 15 sc.
Row 2 (Right Side): Ch 3, skip first st, dc in next st and each st across; turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, slip st in first dc, * dc in next dc, slip st in next dc; repeat from * across working last slip st in top of ch-3; turn.
Rows 4-29: Repeat Rows 2 and 3.
Row 30: Ch 3, skip first st, dc in next st and each st across, ch 10, slip st in last dc for button loop. Fasten off.
Beak
With B ch 6; dc in 3rd ch from hook, hdc in next ch, sc in next ch, slip st in last ch. Fasten off.
Eye (Make 2)
With C ch 4; 11 dc in 3rd ch from hook; join with a slip st to top of ch-3. Fasten off. Sew button to center of eye.
Finishing
Sew Beak and Eyes in place. Sew button to beginning edge to correspond to button loop. Sew first 3 sts of Row 24 to corresponding 3 sts of beginning ch. Weave in ends.

materials: Size 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Tea Cozy to fit 6 cup tea pot. Approx 9 x 8 ins [23 x 20.5 cm].
gauge: 14 hdc and 10 rows = 4 ins [10 cm].
instructions:
DAISY MOTIF
With MC, ch 5. Join with sl st to form a ring.
1st rnd:Ch 1. 10 sc in ring. Join  A with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 7. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 5 petals.
3rd rnd:Ch 1. 1 sc in missed sc in last rnd. *Ch 7. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. 1 sc in next missed sc in last rnd. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 5 petals. Fasten off.
Note:5 petals from 2nd rnd should alternate with 5 petals from 3rd rnd.

TEA COZY
Notes: To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook. Draw loop of next color through 2 loops on hook to complete st and proceed.
Ch 2 does not count as hdc.
Stripe Pattern
Work 2 rows with MC.
Work 2 rows with A.
Work 2 rows with MC.
Work 2 rows with B.
Work 2 rows with MC.
Work 2 rows with A.
Work 2 rows with MC.
These 14 rows form Stripe Pat.
Make 2 pieces alike.
With MC, ch 37.
1st row:(WS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 35 hdc.
2nd row:Ch 2. 1 hdc in 1st hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc through back loop only. *1 hdc in next hdc through front loop only. 1 hdc in next hdc through back loop only. Rep from * to last hdc. 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn.
First row of Stripe Pat is complete.
Keep cont of Stripe Pat, rep last row until 14 rows of Stripe Pat are complete.
Next row: (RS). With MC, ch 1. Working through both loops, 1 sc in first hdc. *Draw up a loop in each of next 2 hdc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook - sc2tog made. Rep from * to end of row. 18 sts.
Next row:Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *Sc2tog over next 2 sts. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. 10 sts.
Rep last row once more. 6 sts. Fasten off.
Edging: With RS of work facing, join MC with sl st to top left corner. Ch 1. Work 22 sc down left side of piece to foundation ch. Fasten off.
With RS of work facing, join MC with sl st to bottom right corner. Ch 1. Work 22 sc up right side of piece. Fasten off.
Place markers on side edges 2 ins [5 cm] from top and bottom.
With WS facing of both pieces, crochet both sides tog from top edge down to marker and from bottom edge up to marker, leaving openings for handle and spout.
With RS facing, join MC with sl st to bottom edge at side seam.
Next rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right instead of from right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Sew Daisy Motif to top of Tea Cozy as shown in picture.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver™ (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Color A Pretty ‘n’ Pink (0722) 1 ball or 18 yds/17 m
Color B Pumpkin (0254) 1 ball or 11 yds/10 m
Color C Café Latte (0360) 1 ball or 7 yds/6.5 m
Contrast A Spring Green (0672) 1 ball or 18 yds/17 m
Contrast B Pumpkin (0254) 1 ball or 11 yds/10 m
Contrast C Café Latte (0360) 1 ball or 7 yds/6.5 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Bobble = (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 4 times all in next stitch. Yoh and draw through all 5 loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 9" [23 cm] in circumference x 3" [7.5 cm] wide.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
See diagram on page 2.
With A, ch 28. Join with sl st in 1st ch, being careful not to twist ch.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc. 28 sc.
Note: Carry yarn not in use loosely across WS of work. To change color, work to last loops on hook, yoh with new color and proceed.
2nd rnd: Ch 1 ( does not count as st). 1 hdc in first sc. *With B, Bobble in next sc. With A, ch 1. 1 hdc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to last 3 sc. With B, Bobble in next sc. 1 hdc in each of last 2 sc. Join with sl st to first hdc.
3rd rnd: With A, ch 1. *1 sc in next hdc. With C, 1 hdc between 2nd and 3rd ‘legs’ of next Bobble. With A, 1 sc in each of next 2 hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1 ( does not count as st). *With A, 1 hdc in next sc. 1 hdc in back loop only of next hdc. 1 hdc in next sc. With B, Bobble in next sc. With A, ch 1. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
5th rnd: With A, ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 hdc. With C, 1 hdc between 2nd and 3rd ‘legs’ of next Bobble. With A, ch 1. Rep from * around.
6th rnd: With A, ch 1 ( does not count as st). 1 hdc in first sc. *With B, Bobble in next sc. With A, ch 1. 1 hdc in next sc. 1 hdc in back loop only of next hdc. 1 hdc in next sc. Rep from * to last 3 sc. With B, Bobble in next sc. 1 hdc in next sc. 1 hdc in back loop only of next hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc.
7th rnd: As 3rd rnd.
8th rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 sc in back loop only of next hdc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around, ending with 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc.
Fasten off.
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® With Love®: 1 skein each 1601 Lettuce A and 1001 White B
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Bottle hugger measures 11” (28 cm) in circumference x 13¼” (33.5 cm) tall x 2¾” (7 cm) in diameter across bottom.
gauge: Rounds 1–7 = 2¾” (7 cm); 19 sts = 5” (12.cm); 18 rows = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain gauge.
instructions:
BOTTLE HUGGER Body
With A, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, 6 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in same st as join and in each st around; join with slip st in first sc—12 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, 2 sc in same st as join, sc in next st, *2 sc in next st, sc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—18 sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in same st as join and in next st, 2 sc in next st, *sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—24 sc.
Round 5: Ch 1, 2 sc in same st as join, sc in next 3 sts, *2 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—30 sc.
Round 6: Ch 1, sc in same st as join and in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st, *sc in next 4 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—36 sc.
Round 7: Ch 1, 2 sc in same st as join, sc in next 5 sts, *2 sc in next st, sc in next 5 sts; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—42 sc.
Round 8: Ch 1, sc in back loop only of each st around; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 9: Ch 2 (does not count as a st here or throughout), dc in same st as join and in each st around; join with slip st in first dc—42 dc.
Rounds 10 and 11: Ch 2, Fpdc around first 3 sts, Bpdc around next 3 sts, *fpdc around next 3 sts, Bpdc around next 3 sts; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first dc—21 Fpdc and 21 Bpdc.
Round 12: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc—42 sc.
Round 13: Repeat Round 9.
Rounds 14 and 15: Ch 2, Bpdc around first 3 sts, Fpdc around next 3 sts, *bpdc about the next 3 sts, Fpdc around next 3 sts; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first dc—21 Bpdc and 21 Fpdc.
Round 16: Repeat Round 12.
Round 17: Repeat Round 9.
Rounds 18 and 19: Ch 2, skip first st, dc in next 2 sts, Fptr around skipped st, Bpdc around next 3 sts, *skip next st, dc in next 2 sts, Fptr around skipped st, Bpdc around next 3 sts; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first dc—4 dc, 21 Bpdc, and 7 Fptr.
Round 20: Repeat Round 12.
Round 21: Repeat Round 9.
Rounds 22 and 23: Ch 2, Bpdc around first 3 sts, skip next st, dc in next 2 sts, Fptr around skipped st, *bpdc around next 3 sts, skip next st, dc in next 2 sts, Fptr around skipped st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first dc—14 dc, 21 Bpdc, and 7 Fptr.
Rounds 24–31: Repeat Rounds 16–23.
Round 32: Repeat Round 12.
Rounds 33–36: Repeat Rounds 9–12.
Round 37: Repeat Round 9.
Rounds 38 and 39: Repeat Rounds 14 and 15.
Rounds 40 and 41: Repeat Round 12.
Handles
Round 42: Ch 1, sc in same st as join and in next 5 sts, ch 12, skip next 10 sts, sc in next 11 sts, ch 12, skip next 10 sts, sc in last 5 sts; join with slip st in first sc—22 sc and 2 ch-12 spaces.
Round 43: Ch 1, sc in each st and ch around; join with slip st in first sc—46 sc.
Rounds 44 and 45: Repeat Round 12.
Fasten off.
Arm (make 2)
Ch 18; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 2, dc in each ch around; join with slip st in first dc—18 dc.
Rounds 2 and 3: Repeat Rounds 10 and 11 of body—9 Fpdc and 9 Bpdc.
Round 4: Repeat Round 12 of body—18 sc.
Round 5: Repeat Round 9 of body—18 dc.
Rounds 6 and 7: Repeat Rounds 22 and 23 of body—6 dc, 9 Bpdc, and 3 Fptr.
Round 8: Repeat Round 12 of body. Fasten off.
Left Hand
Row 1 (right side): With right side of last round of first arm facing, join B with sc in 3rd st at right of seam, sc in next 5 sts, turn—6 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Row 3: Ch 4, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 2 ch, sc in each st across, turn—9 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in first 6 sts; leave remaining sts unworked, turn—6 sc.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in first 4 sts, sc2tog, turn—5 sc.
Row 6: Ch 1, sc in first 3 sts, sc2tog, turn—4 sc.
Row 7: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sts, sc2tog, turn—3 sc.
Row 8: Ch 1, sc in first st, sc2tog—2 sc. Fasten off.
Right Hand
Row 1 (right side): With wrong side of last round of 2nd arm facing, join B with sc in 3rd st at right of seam, sc in next 5 sts, turn—6 sc.
Rows 2–8: Repeat Rows 2–8 of left hand.
ASSEMBLY
Flatten arms and arrange them with thumbs up. Referring to photograph as a guide, angle arms down slightly so that hands are positioned lower on body than ends of arms. Sew hands in place approximately 6” (15 cm) from bottom of body. Wrap arms around body and sew in place on back of body.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each of 387 Soft Navy A, 320 Cornmeal B, and 316 Soft White C.
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C
measurements: Hug fits 4” high mug with 3” top diameter and bottom diameter.
gauge: 4 sts = 1”; 4 rows = 1”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain gauge.
instructions:
HUG
Wrap
With A and H hook, ch 14.
Row 1: Sc in second ch from hook and each remaining ch across, ch 1; turn – 13 sc.
Rows 2 – 40: Sc in each sc across, ch 1; turn. At end of Row 40, ch 10, slip st in last sc of Row 40 (button loop made).
Fasten off. Sew bottom 3 sts of beginning ch to bottom 3 sc of Row 40.

Moon
With B and E hook, ch 2.
Row 1: 6 sc in second ch from hook, ch 1; turn – 6 sc.
Row 2: 2 sc in each sc across, ch 1; turn – 12 sc.
Row 3: Sc in each sc across, ch 1; turn.
Row 4: 3 sc in first sc, sc to last sc, 3 sc in last sc, ch 1; turn – 16 sc.
Row 5: Repeat Row 4 – 20 sc. 
Fasten off. 

Star (Make 2 or as many as you like)
With C and E hook, ch 2.
Round 1: 5 sc in second ch from hook – 5 sc.
Round 2: (Slip st, ch 2, slip st) in each sc around. 
Fasten off.

ASSEMBLY
Using photo as a guide, sew moon onto wrap with B. Using floss, embroider eye and mouth onto moon with straight st. With C, sew stars onto wrap. Sew button onto back of wrap. Weave in ends.

pattern_name: Coffee on the Go Crochet Cozy
materials: Caron® Simply Soft™ (6 oz/170 g; 315 yds/288 m) Mango (9605) 1 ball
Size U.S. G/6 [4 mm] Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dc2togCl = (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice in indicated stitch. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 8½" [21.5 cm] in circumference by 3" [7.5 cm] tall.
gauge: 15 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes: 
• Cozy is worked lengthwise. 
• Cozy should be slightly smaller than cup circumference for a snug fit.
• Ch 3 at beg of row counts as dc.
Ch 14. 
1st row: 1 Dc2togCl in 4th ch from hook (counts as 1 dc and 1 dc2togCl). 1 Dc2togCl in each chain to last ch. 1 dc in last ch. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3. Dc2togCl between first dc and next dc2togCl. *Dc2togCl between next 2 dc2togCl. Rep from * to last dc. 1 dc in last dc. Turn. 
Rep last row for pat until work from beg, when slightly stretched measures 8½" [21.5 cm]. Fasten off. Using whip st, sew foundation row and last row tog.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 885 Delft Blue A, 321 Gold B, and 312 Black C.
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Hug fits 4” high mug with 3” top diameter and bottom diameter.
gauge: 4 rows = 1”; 4 sts = 1”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain gauge.
instructions:
HUG
Wrap
With A, ch 14.
Row 1: Sc in second ch from hook and each remaining ch across, ch 1; turn – 13 sc.
Rows 2 – 40: Sc in each sc across, ch 1; turn. At end of Row 40, ch 10; slip st in last sc of Row 40 (button loop made). Fasten off. Sew bottom 3 sts of beginning ch to bottom 3 sts of Row 40.
Sun
With B, ch 2.
Round 1: 6 sc in second ch from hook – 6 sc.
Round 2: 2 sc in each sc around – 12 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] – 18 sc.
Round 4: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] – 24 sc.
Round 5: *Slip st in next sc, ch 4, slip st in second ch from hook, hdc in next ch, dc in next ch, skip next 2 sc; repeat from * around. Fasten off.
Nose
With B, ch 3; work 4 hdc in third ch from hook. Fasten off.
Sunglasses (Make 2)
With C, ch 2; work 6 sc in second ch from hook; join. Fasten off.
ASSEMBLY
Using photo as a guide, fold nose in half lengthwise and sew onto sun with B. Using floss, sew sunglasses onto sun; embroider sides and middle of glasses with straight sts; embroider couched stitch smile. Using B, sew sun onto wrap. Sew button onto back of wrap. Weave in ends. This nice gift idea will brighten the day with a smiling face and let someone know you care. Crochet one for yourself too. It will keep a morning cup of coffee or tea warm while you enjoy your morning.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein 316 Soft White A; small amount 312 Black B
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Item fits mug 3½” (8.9 cm) diameter and 4” (10 cm) high.
gauge: 16 sts = 4” [10 cm]; 8 rows = 3” [7.5 cm]. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HUG
With A,ch 13.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across; turn – 12 sc.
Rows 2-34: Ch 1, sc in back loop only of each sc across; turn.
Row 35: Ch 1, sc in back loop only of each sc across, ch 8; turn.
Row 36: Skip 8 ch, sc in back loop only of each sc across. Do NOT fasten off.
Bottom Shaping
Note: Remainder of hug is worked in continuous rounds without turning.
Round 1: Continuing down side edge, work a sc in the end of each row; join to first sc of round with a slip st; do not turn – 36 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, *sc in next sc, sc2tog; repeat from * around; join – 24 sc. Fasten off.

MUSTACHE
With B, ch 16.
Row 1: Slip st in 2nd ch from hook; draw up a loop in each of next 3 chs, yo and draw through all 4 loops on hook; hdc in next 2 chs, (dc, sc) in next ch, slip st in next ch, (sc, dc) in next ch, hdc in next 2 chs; draw up a loop in each of next 3 chs, yo and draw through all 4 loops on hook; slip st in last ch.  Fasten off.

measurements: Cozy measures 2½" wide x 6¾" long (6.5 x 17 cm), flattened.
gauge: 7 sc = 2" (5cm); 12 rows = 4" (10cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
COZY (make 4)
Make an adjustable ring, ch 2.
Set-up Round: Work 9 sc in 2nd ch from hook—9 sc. Do not join. Place marker for beginning of round.
Round 1: Working in back loops only, 2 sc in each sc around—18 sc.
Round 2: Working in back loops only, sc in each sc around.
Repeat Round 2 until cozy measures 6½" (16.5 cm) long or to desired length.
Last round: Slip st in each st around; join with invisible join in first slip st. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

pattern_name: SANTA AND HIS ELF CROCHET CUP COZIES
materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Contrast A Hot Red (0390) 1 ball or 32 yds/29.5 m
Contrast B Spring Green (0672) 1 ball or 32 yds/29.5 m
Contrast C Black (0312) 1 ball or 6 yds/5.5 m
Contrast D White (0311) 1 ball or 4 yds/3.8 m
Contrast E Gold (0321) 1 ball or 1 yd/.9 m
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Sized to fit standard take out size Medium coffee cup - 10" [25.5 cm] circumference around top edge, 8" [20.5 cm] circumference around bottom edge, 3" [7.5 cm] high (excluding legs).
gauge: 12 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
Santa: Use A as Color 1.
Use C as Color 2.
Use D as Color 3.
Use E as Color 4.
Elf: Use B as Color 1.
Use C as Color 2.
Use D as Color 3.
Use E as Color 4.
Cup Cozy
With Color 1, ch 24. Join with sl st to first ch, making sure not to twist ch.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join. 24 sc.
2nd and 3rd rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Break Color 1. Join with Color 2.
5th rnd: With Color 2, ch 1. Working in back loops only, *1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 27 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Break Color 2. Join with Color 1. 30 sc.
7th rnd: With Color 1, ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
8th and 9th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
10th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Break Color 1. Join with Color 3.
11th rnd: With Color 3, ch 1. Working from left to right, instead of from right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Fasten off.
Arms and Legs (make 4 alike)
With Color 1, ch 7.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 6 sc.
2nd to 4th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Fasten off.
Sew first and last rows tog.
Join Color 3 with sl st to either end.
1st rnd: Ch 1. Work 4 sc evenly around. Break Color 3. Join with Color 2. 4 sc.
2nd and 3rd rnds: With Color 2, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Fasten off leaving a long end.
Draw end tightly through rem sts.
Sew 2 Legs to bottom edge of Cup Cozy as shown in photo.
Sew 2 Arms to Cup Cozy as shown in photo. Using a small length of Color 2, sew hands tog as shown in photo.
Belt Buckle:
With length of Color 4 and using embroidery chain st, embroider Belt Buckle as shown in photo.

materials: RED HEART® Soft®: 1 ball 1882 Toast A
small amounts of 4601 Off White B
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Cozy measures 9.5” (24 cm) wide by 4” (10 cm) tall and fits 12 oz. soda can.
gauge: With double strand yarn, 12 hdc = 4” [10 cm]; 11 rows hdc = 4” [10 cm]. With single strand yarn, 14 sc = 4” [10 cm]; 20 rows sc = 4” [10 cm]. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Football Can Cozy
Enjoy a soda (or other libation) served in this stylish cozy while you watch the game! Our football can cozy has personality plus, making it perfect for giving to enthusiastic football fans. Why not crochet a cozy or two while watching the game?

Rounds 6-13: Sc in each sc around.
Round 14: [Sc2tog, sc in each of the next 3 sc] 12 times — 48 sc.
Round 15: Sc in each sc around.
Round 16: [Sc2tog, sc in each of the next 2 sc] 12 times — 36 sc.
Round 17: Sc in each sc around.
Begin stuffing to create round ball shape. Stuff firmly to define shape but do not overstuff or stretch stitches (this helps prevent stuffing from showing through work). It may be helpful to place a soda can inside the Lining to hold its shape while working. Continue stuffing as you close.
Round 18: [Sc2tog, sc in the next sc] 12 times — 24 sc.
Round 19: Join Ball to Lining by single crocheting Ball Round 18 and open loops of Lining Round 5 together. Match and sc together each st and loop around, stuffing and shaping. Fasten off. Weave ends in.
Football End (Make 2)
End is worked in continuous rounds without joining or turning. Using one strand of A, ch 2.
Round 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook — 6 sc.
Round 2: [2 sc in next sc] 6 times — 12 sc.
Round 3: Sc in each sc around.
Round 4: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc] 6 times — 18 sc.
Round 5: Sc in each sc around.
Round 6: [Sc in each of the next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times — 24 sc.
Round 7: Sc in each sc around.
Round 8: [2 sc in next sc, sc in each of the next 3 sc] 6 times — 30 sc.
Round 9: Sc in each sc around.

Lining is worked holding two strands of yarn throughout. With A, ch 2.
Round 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with slip st in first st — 6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, [2 sc in next sc] 6 times; join — 12 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, [2 hdc in next sc, hdc in next sc] 6 times; join — 18 hdc.
Round 4: Ch 1, [Hdc in each of the next 2 hdc, 2 hdc in the next hdc] 6 times; join — 24 hdc.
Round 5: Ch 1, hdc in back loop only of each hdc around; join — 24 hdc.
Rounds 6-12: Ch 1, hdc in each hdc around; join — 24 hdc. Fasten off. Weave ends in.
Ball
Ball is worked in continuous rounds without joining or turning. Use a stitch holder to mark the beginning of each Round, moving up as work progresses. Using one strand of A, hold Liner with the top facing and join yarn in any back loop of Liner Round 12.
Round 1: [Sc in back loop of next st, 2 sc in back loop of next st] 12 times — 36 sc.
Round 2: Sc in each sc around.
Round 3: [2 sc in next sc, sc in each of the next 2 sc] 12 times — 48 sc.
Round 4: Sc in each sc around.
Round 5: [Sc in each of the next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 12 times — 60 sc.
Round 10: Sc in each of the next 2 sc, [2 sc in next sc, sc in each of the next 4 sc] 5 times, 2 sc in next sc, sc in each of the next 2 sc — 36 sc.
Round 11: Sc in each sc around to last sc; insert hook into last sc, yarn over and draw up loop (2 loops on hook), change to B, yarn over with B, draw through both loops to complete sc; continue with B.
Round 12: [2 sc, sc in each of the next 5 sc] 6 times — 42 sc.
Round 13: Sc in each sc around. Fasten off ends, leaving a 12” (30.5 cm) tail for sewing.
Finishing
Using photograph as a guide, stuff and sew the Football Ends to opposite sides of the Ball, creating a football shape.
For Mouth and Laces: With B, ch 8. Slip st in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across — 7 slip sts. Fasten off, leaving 24” (60.9 cm) tail for sewing. Position Mouth about two-thirds of the way down on the Ball and sew on. Using the extra length of tail, satin stitch 4 Laces evenly across the Mouth.
For Eyes: using C and working over 2 or 3 sts, satin stitch the Eyes about 4 rounds above the Mouth and 3 stitches apart. Add Eyebrows. Fasten off, weave in ends.

materials: 1 skein each 368 Paddy Green A and 672 Spring Green B
RED HEART® Super Saver®, Art. E300 available in solid color 7 oz (198 g), 364 yd (333 m); prints, multicolor and heather 5 oz (141 g), 236 yd (215 m), flecks 5 oz (141 g), 260 yds (238 m) skeins
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Cozy measures 3½” long x 10” circumference (9 x 25.5 cm).
gauge: 9 sc = 2½” (6.5 cm); 10 rows = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
With A, ch 10.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—9 sc.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as first hdc, ch 1), skip next sc, hdc in next sc, *ch 1, skip next sc, hdc in next sc; repeat from * across, turn—5 hdc and 4 ch-1 sps.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each hdc and ch-1 space working last sc in 2nd ch of beginning ch, turn—9 sc.
Rows 4–25: Repeat Rows 2 and 3 eleven times.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
FINISHING
Sew short ends together.
Edging (work twice)
Round 1: With right side facing and working in ends of rows, join B with slip st in any row, *ch 3, slip st in next row; repeat from * around to first slip st, ch 3; join with slip st in first slip st. Fasten off.
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Team Spirit™: 1 skein in color of your choice will make several cozies.
abbreviations: [] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: 1½” fit 2½”-3” diameter cans; directions for large cans to fit diameter cans and bottles.
gauge: 14 sts = 4”; 10 rows = 4” in hdc/sc pattern. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
COZY
Bottom
Round 1: Ch 5; join with a slip st in first ch to form ring; ch 1, 7 sc in ring; join with a slip st in first sc – 7 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc around; join – 14 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in first sc, 2 sc in next sc, [sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times; join – 21 sc.
Size Large Can Only-Round 4: Ch 1, sc in first sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc, [sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc] 6 times; join – 28 sc.
Both Sizes-Sides
Round 1: Working in back loops only, ch 2, hdc in next sc and in each sc around; join with a slip st in top of ch-2; TURN.
Now work in both loops.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in same st as joining and in each hdc around; join; TURN.
Round 3: Ch 2, hdc in next sc and in each sc around; join; TURN.
Repeat Rounds 2 and 3 for height desired, ending on Round 2.
Choice of Edgings
Reverse Sc: With right side facing, working from left to right, sc in each st around; join. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
OR
Sc Edging: With right side facing, ch 1, sc in each st around; join. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
Show your spirit with can cozies in favorite team colors! These crochet cozies are sized to fit smaller energy drink cans or regular size cans and bottles. Great treat for the whole cheering section!

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® Ombres (2 oz/56.7 g ; 95 yds/86 m)
Size U.S. H or 8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: 13 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
INSTRUCTIONS
Main Piece
Ch 37.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 
1 sc in each ch across. Turn. 36 sc.
**2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back loop 
only of each sc, 1 sc in each sc across. 
Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg 
measures 4" [10 cm]. Fasten off.**
Sides (make 2). 
Ch 12.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 
1 sc in each ch across. Turn. 11 sc. 
Rep from ** to ** as for Main Piece.
Join Sides to Main Piece: Place  
1 Side at each end of Main Piece and 
pin outer edges tog. With RS facing, 
join yarn with sl st in any corner. Ch 1. 
Work 1 row of sc around outer edge 
(through both thicknesses of Side and 
Main Piece at each end), working 3 sc 
in each corner. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Fasten off.
Note: Slip each end around the 
dusting tool’s base. When one side 
is soiled, flip the side pockets inside-
out and use the opposite side to keep 
cleaning! The ridge stitch design helps 
trap dirt.

materials: Patons® Classic Wool (100 g / 3.5 oz; 192 m / 210 yds)
Main Color (MC) (00225 Dark Grey Mix) 1 ball
Small quantity of black and red yarn for embroidery
measurements: Approx 9" [23 cm] circumference.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm] with 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) hook.
instructions:
Note: To join new color, work to last 2 loops on hook. Draw new color through last 2 loops then proceed in new color.
COZY
With MC and larger hook, ch 24. Join in ring with sl st into first ch, taking care not to twist ch.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
2nd and 3rd rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. Rep from * once. Join with sl st to first sc. 26 sc.
5th and 6th rnds: As 2nd and 3rd rnds.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 12 sc. Rep from * once. Join with sl st to first sc. 28 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join A with sl st to first sc. Break MC.
9th rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
10th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 13 sc. Rep from * once. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sc.
11th and 12th rnds: As 2nd and 3rd rnds, joining B with sl st at end of 12th rnd. Break A.
13th rnd: With B, ch 1. *2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 14 sc. Rep from * once. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sc.
14th rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right, instead of from right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st in first sc. Fasten off.
MUZZLE
With A and smaller hook, ch 7.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 4 ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working in opposite side of ch, work 1 sc in each of next 4 ch. 2 sc in last ch. Join with sl st to first sc. 14 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 20 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Reverse Sc.
EARS (make 2).
With MC and smaller hook, ch 15.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 13 ch. Turn. 14 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sts. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – Sc2tog made. (Sc2tog) 6 times. Turn. 7 sts.
3rd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Draw up a loop in each of next 3 sts. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – Sc3tog made. Sc2tog. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew side ends of Ears together, creating a cupped shape. Sew Ears to Cozy as shown. Lightly stuff Muzzle and sew to Cozy as shown. With red yarn, work back stitch embroidery to form a curved line for mouth. With black yarn, stitch two X stitches above mouth as shown. Sew 2 buttons to Cozy to form eyes as shown.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein 376 Burgundy
abbreviations: ( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Cozy measures 11” (28 cm) in circumference x 13¼” (33.5 cm) tall x 2¾” (7 cm) in diameter across bottom.
gauge: Rounds 1–7 = 2¾” (7 cm); 19 sc = 5” (12 cm); 18 rounds = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain gauge.
instructions:
COZY
Make an adjustable ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, 6 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in same st as join and in each st around; join with slip st in first sc—12 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, 2 sc in same st as join, sc in next st, *2 sc in next st, sc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—18 sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in same st as join and in next st, 2 sc in next st, *sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—24 sc.
Round 5: Ch 1, 2 sc in same st as join, sc in next 3 sts, *2 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—30 sc.
Round 6: Ch 1, sc in same st as join and in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st, *sc in next 4 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—36 sc.
Round 7: Ch 1, 2 sc in same st as join, sc in next 5 sts, *2 sc in next st, sc in next 5 sts; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—42 sc.
Round 8: Ch 1, sc in back loop only of each st around; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 9: Ch 4 (counts as first tr here and throughout), tr in next st, *skip next 2 sts, (2 tr, ch 1, 2 tr) in next st, skip next 2 sts, *tr in next 2 sts, skip next 2 sts, (2 tr, ch 1, 2 tr) in next st; repeat from * around, skip last 2 sts; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—36 tr and 6 ch-1 spaces.
Rounds 10 and 11: Ch 4, tr in next st, skip next 2 sts, (2 tr, ch 1, 2 tr) in next ch-1 space, *skip next 2 sts, tr in next 2 sts, skip next 2 sts, (2 tr, ch 1, 2 tr) in next ch-1 space; repeat from * around, skip last 2 sts; join with slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 12: Ch 1, sc in same st as join and in each st and ch around; join with slip st in first sc—42 sc.
Rounds 13 and 14: Ch 1, sc in same st as join and in each st around; join with slip st in first sc.
Rounds 15–26: Repeat Rounds 9–14 twice.
Rounds 27–31: Repeat Rounds 9–13.
Handles
Round 32: Ch 1, sc in same st as join and in next 5 sts, ch 12, skip next 10 sts, sc in next 11 sts, ch 12, skip next 10 sts, sc in last 5 sts; join with slip st in first sc—22 sc and 2 ch-12 spaces.
Rounds 33 and 34: Repeat Rounds 13 and 14—46 sc.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 672 Spring Green A, 886 Blue B, 324 Bright Yellow C, 254 Pumpkin D, 311 White E, 312 Black F, 390 Hot Red G, and 722 Pretty in Pink H
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Cozy measures 13” circumference x 7” tall (33 x 18 cm) and fits 1-quart Mason jar.
gauge: 8 sc = 2” (2 cm); Rows GAUGE. Use any size to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
COZY
Cover (make 3 – 1 each with A, B, and C)
Ch 30.
Row 1: (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—29 sc.
Row 2: Ch 4 (counts as dc, ch 1 here and throughout) skip next sc, (dc, ch 1, dc) in next sc, *ch 1, skip next sc, (dc, ch 1, dc) in next sc; repeat from * across, to last 2 sc, ch 1, skip next sc, dc in last sc, turn—28 dc and 27 ch-1 spaces.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each dc and ch-1 space across working last sc in 3rd ch of beginning ch, turn—55 sc.
Row 4: Ch 4, skip next sc, dc in next sc, *ch 1, skip next sc, dc in next sc; repeat from * across, turn—28 dc and 27 ch-1 spaces.
Row 5: Repeat Row 3.
Rows 6–17: Repeat last 2 rows 6 times.
Row 18: Ch 1, *sc in next 9 sc, sc2tog; repeat from * across, turn—50 sc.
Row 19: Ch 1, *sc in next 8 sc, sc2tog; repeat from * across, turn—45 sc.
Row 20: Repeat Row 4—23 dc and 22 ch-1 spaces.
Row 21: Ch 1, sc in first dc, *skip next ch-1 space, 4 dc in next dc, skip next ch-1 space, sc in next dc; repeat from * across—12 sc and eleven 4-dc groups. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

Skull (make 3 – 1 each with B, D, and H)
Ch 4.
Row 1 (wrong side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—3 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in next sc, 2 sc in last sc, turn—5 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first sc, *2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc; repeat from * once, turn—7 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in last sc, turn—9 sc.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in first sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in each sc across to last 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last sc, turn—11 sc.
Rows 6–11: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 12: Ch 1, 3 sc in first sc, sc in next 9 sc, 3 sc in last sc, turn—15 sc.
Row 13: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each sc across to last sc, 2 sc in last sc, turn—17 sc.
Rows 14–21: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Rows 22 and 23: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each sc across to last 2 sc, sc2tog, turn—15 sc.
Round 24: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each sc across to last 2 sc, sc2tog; working in ends of rows and in opposite side of foundation ch, sc evenly spaced around piece, working additional sc in end of any row as needed for piece to lay flat. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

Headpiece (make 3 – 2 with A and 1 with B)
Row 1: Ch 8, hdc in 3rd ch from hook, dc in next ch, ch 3. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

Eye (make 6 – 2 each with E, F, and G)
Ch 2.
Round 1 (right side): 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc. Do not join.
Round 2: 2 sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc—12 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

Nose (make 3 – 1 each with B, F, and H)
Row 1: Ch 5, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

Mouth (make 3 with E)
Round 1: Ch 8, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 5 ch, 3 sc in last ch; working in opposite side of foundation ch, skip first ch, sc in next 5 ch, 2 sc in last ch; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

Tie (make 3 – 1 each with A, B, and C)
Ch 90.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across. Fasten off.

ASSEMBLY
Use photograph as a guide for placement of pieces and embroidery stitching. Assemble 3 skulls in the following color sequences:
With A-colored cover: Skull with D, headpiece with A, eyes and mouth with E, nose with B
With B-colored cover: Skull with H, headpiece with B, eyes and nose with F, mouth with E
With C-colored cover: Skull with B, headpiece with A, eyes with G, nose with H, mouth with E
Sew headpiece to top of skull.
Embroider 4 lazy daisy stitches in center of each eye as follows: F-colored sts on E-colored eye, C-colored sts on F-colored eye, E-colored sts on G-colored eye.
Embroider a French knot in center of each eye as follows: G-colored knot on E-colored eye, H-colored knot on F-colored eye, F-colored knot on G-colored eye. Sew eyes to skulls.
Weave tail of nose through lower edge and gather slightly to form a half-circle and sew to skull.
With 6 strands of black floss, back stitch horizontally across center of mouth, then work small straight stitches vertically to form teeth. Sew mouth on skull.
Embroider 6 small straight stitches and 6 French knots around each eye as follows: A-colored sts and C- and F-colored knots on D-colored skull, B-colored sts C- and E-colored knots on H-colored skull, C-colored sts and A- and H-colored knots on B-colored skull.
Center skull on right side of cover and sew in place. With ending tail, sew ends of rows of cover together. Place cover on Mason jar.

FINISHING
Weave in ends. Beginning at side of cover, weave tie through Row 20 and tie in a bow.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 319 Cherry Red A, 316 Soft White B, and 385 Royal C
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Cozy measures 4” (10 cm) wide x 8” long (20.5 cm), measured flat.
gauge: 10 sc = 3” (10 cm); 7 rows = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions: COZY Body With A, ch 17. Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—16 sc. Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each st across; change to B, turn. Row 3: Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in each st across, turn. Row 4: Ch 1, sc in each st across; change to A, turn. Row 5: Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in each st across, turn. Rows 6–25: Repeat Rows 2–5 five times. Rows 26–28: Repeat Rows 2–4; do not change color at end of last row. Cut A. Fasten off B leaving a long tail for sewing. Sew first and last rows together. Neck Round 1 (right side): With right side of either edge facing, join C with slip st in seam, ch 1, working in ends of rows, sc in each row around—28 sc. Do not join. Place marker for beginning of round and move marker up as each round is completed. Round 2: *Sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog; repeat from * around—21 sc. Round 3: *Sc in next sc, sc2tog; repeat from * around—14 sc. Round 4: [Sc2tog] 7 times—7 sc. Rounds 5–10: Sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc at end of last round. Fasten off. FINISHING Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Soft Baby Steps®: 1 ball each 9505 Aqua A and 9590 Lavender B
RED HEART® Soft®: 1 ball each 4601 Off White C and 4614 Black D
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 6.0mm [US J-10], 5.0mm [US H-8], 3.5mm [US E-4], 2.75mm [US C-2]
abbreviations: A, B, C, D = Color A, Color B, Color C, Color D
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Cozy fits doorknobs 6¼” (16 cm) around.
gauge: 16 sc = 4” [10 cm]; 20 rows = 4” [10 cm]. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size needles/hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
Nose
With 2.75mm [C-2] hook and D, ch 3.
Row 1: Work (dc, hdc, sc, dc, sc, hdc, dc) all in 3rd ch from hook, ch 2, slip st into same st as last dc—8 sts. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

Spot
With 3.5mm [E-4] hook and B, ch 3.
Round 1: Work (6 hdc, 6 dc) In 3rd ch from hook; slip st in first st to join—12 sts. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

Eye (Make 2)
With 3.5mm [E-4] hook and C, ch 2.
Round 1: 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook; slip st in first st to join—5 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

Pupil (Make 2)
With 2.75mm [C-2] hook and D, ch 2.
Round 1: 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook; slip st into same st as last sc —2 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

Ear (Make 2)
Make one Ear with A and one with B. With 5.0mm [H-8] hook, ch 2.
Round 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc.
Round 2: [2 sc in next sc, 2 sc] twice—8 sc.
Round 3: [2 sc in next sc, 3 sc] twice—10 sc.
Round 4: Sc in each sc around—10 sc.
Round 5: Sc2tog, 8 sc—9 sc.
Round 6: Sc in each sc around—9 sc.
Round 7: Sc2tog, 7 sc—8 sc.
Round 8: Sc2tog, 6 sc—7 sc.
Round 9: Sc2tog, 5 sc—6 sc.
Round 10: Sc in each sc around—6 sc.
Round 11: Sc2tog; pinch the opening closed.

COZY
Head
With 6.0mm [J-10] hook and A, ch 2.
Round 1: 6 sc in second ch from hook—6 sc.
Round 2: [2 sc in sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc] twice—10 sc.
Round 3: Sc, 2 sc in next sc, 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc, 2 sc—12 sc.
Round 4: Sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Round 5: Working in front loops only, [sc, 2 sc in next sc, 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] twice, sc, 2 sc in next sc—17 sc.
Round 6: Working in both loops, 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc, [3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 3 times, 2 sc—21 sc.
Round 7: [6 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 3 times—24 sc.
Round 8: 11 sc, 2 sc in next sc, 12 sc—25 sc.
Round 9: Sc in each sc around—25 sc.
Round 10: 12 sc, sc2tog, 11 sc; ch 1, turn—24 sc.
Round 11: [6 sc, sc2tog] 3 times; ch 1, turn—21 sc.
Round 12: [3 sc, sc2tog] 4 times, sc; ch 1, turn—17 sc.
Round 13: [Sc, sc2tog] 5 times, 2 sc—12 sc.
Fasten off, weave in ends.

Finishing
Referring to photograph for placement, sew Nose to snout in center of Cozy. Embroider a mouth on snout below the Nose. Sew Pupils to Eyes. Sew one Eye to Spot, then sew Spot to Cozy above the snout. Sew other Eye above the snout. Sew Ears above Eyes. Weave in all ends.

materials: 1 skein each 1401 Pewter A and 1308 Tan B
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Cozy measures 3" (7.5 cm) in diameter x 4" (10 cm) tall.
gauge: Rounds 1–5 = 3" (7.5 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
COZY
With A, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc—12 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in first sc, 2 sc in next sc, *sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—18 sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc, *sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—24 sc.
Round 5: Ch 1, sc in first 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc, *sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—30 sc.
Round 6: Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 7: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc.
Rounds 8–11: Repeat Round 7; change to B at end of Round 11.
Rounds 12 and 13: Repeat Round 7; change to A at end of Round 13.
Rounds 14–19: Repeat Round 7.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Handicrafter® Cotton (50 g/1.75 oz; 80 m/73 yds)
Size 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
1 m/1 yd of Country Red (13530) for nose.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 3½" [9 cm] high and 10" [25.5 cm] around top edge.
gauge: 14 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: When joining colors, work to last 2 loops on hook of first color. Draw new color through last 2 loops and proceed.
CoZY
With MC, ch 28. Join in ring with sl st into first ch, taking care not to twist ch.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc. 28 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 13 sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sc.
4th and 5th rnds: As 2nd rnd.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 14 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sc.
7th and 8th rnds: As 2nd rnd.
9th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 15 sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. Join with sl st to first sc. 34 sc.
10th and 11th rnds: As 2nd rnd.
12th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 16 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 36 sc.
13th rnd: As 2nd rnd.
14th rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right instead of right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
HEAD
With MC, ch 2.
1st rnd: 4 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. Join with sl st to first sc. 6 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sc.
6th and 7th rnds: As 4th rnd.
8th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog) 6 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc. Fasten off. Stuff Head.
EARS (make 2).
With MC, ch 2.
1st rnd: 4 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. Join with sl st to first sc. 6 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in next sc. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
ANTLERS (make 2).
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 4 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
LEGS (make 4).
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 4 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join MC with sl st to first sc. Break A.
3rd to 8th rnds: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Fasten off after last rnd.
TAIL (make 1).
With MC, ch 2.
1st rnd: 4 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd to 4th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off after last rnd.
FINISHING
Sew Antlers and Ears to Head as shown in picture. With A, embroider eyes using French knots. With red yarn, embroider nose using Satin stitch. Sew Head, Legs and Tail to Cozy as shown in picture.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each of 360 Café A, 312 Black B, and 316 Soft White C.
Yarn needle, two 9mm buttons, ¾” diameter button, black embroidery floss.
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C etc.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Hug fits 4” high mug with 3” top diameter bottom diameter.
gauge: 8 sts = 2”; 8 rows = 2”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain gauge.
instructions:
HUG
Wrap
With A and H hook, ch 14.
Row 1: Sc in second ch from hook and each remaining ch across, ch 1; turn – 13 sc.
Rows 2 – 34: Working in back loops only, sc in each sc across, ch 1; turn. At end of Row 34, ch 10, join with slip st to last sc of Row 34 (button loop made).
Fasten off.
Puppy Muzzle
With C and E hook, ch 2.
Round 1: 6 sc in second ch from hook – 6 sc.
Round 2: 2 sc in each sc around – 12 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] – 18 sc.
Round 4: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] – 24 sc.
Fasten off.
Puppy Ear (Make 2)
With B and E hook, ch 5.
Row 1: Sc in second ch from hook and each remaining ch across; ch 1; turn – 4 sc.
Row 2: Sc in next sc, 2 sc in each of next 2 sc, sc in last sc, ch 1; turn – 6 sc.
Rows 3 – 7: Sc in each sc across, ch 1; turn.
Row 8: Sc2tog, sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog, ch 1; turn – 4 sc.
Row 9: [Sc2tog] 2 times – 2 sc.
Row 10: Sc2tog.
Fasten off.
ASSEMBLY
Using photo as a guide, embroider satin st nose and straight st mouth onto muzzle with floss. Using C, sew muzzle onto wrap. With floss, sew 9mm button eyes and ears onto wrap. Sew ¾” button onto back of wrap. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 324 bright Yellow, 3934 Day Glow or color of your choice
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: US I-9 [5.5 mm]
measurements: Cozy measures 4” (10 cm) wide x 3½” (8.9 cm) tall, before seaming
instructions:
COZY
Ch14.
Row 1: Sc in second chain from hook and in each chain across. (13 sc). Ch1, turn.
Rows 2-11: Sc across; ch1, turn.
Row 12: Sc across leaving a long end for seaming; pull end through loop and tighten.
Fold in half with row ends together. Using yarn needle, sew edges together. Finish off and weave in ends.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m) Jute (00082) 1 ball or 110 yds/100 m
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
5 yds/4.5 m of Lily ® Sugar'n Cream ® Country Red (01530) for pompom.
measurements: Approx 11" [28 cm] square.
gauge: 12 sc and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Ch 29.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 
1 sc in each ch to end of chain. 28 sc. 
Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sl st in first sc. 1 hdc in 
next sc. *Sl st in next sc. 1 hdc in next 
sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. Sl st in first hdc. 1 hdc 
in next sl st. *Sl st in next hdc. 1 hdc 
in next sl st. Rep from * to end of row. 
Turn.
Rep 3rd row until work from beg 
measures 10½" [26.5 cm]. Fasten off.
Edging: 1st rnd: With RS facing, join 
yarn with sl st in bottom left corner. 
Ch 1. 3 sc in same sp. Work 1 rnd of 
sc evenly around outer edges, working 
3 sc in each corner. Join with sl st to 
first sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to 
right instead of from right to left as 
usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc 
across. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Nose Pompom: Wind Country Red 
around 2 fingers approx 30 times. 
Remove from fingers and tie tightly in 
center. Cut through each side of loops. 
Trim to a smooth round shape. Attach 
to Washcloth as shown in picture.
Closure: Wrap Washcloth around 
bar of soap and wrap 1 pipe cleaner 
around cloth to close. 
Antlers: Cut 1 pipe cleaner in half. 
Wrap half pipe cleaner near top of 
other half pipe cleaner to form antler. 
Rep for opposite side. Secure antlers 
to pipe cleaner closure.
